CETL.description: Topics of Current Interest.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

CETL.name: Advanced Environmental Data Analysis
CETL.description: A unified view of the theories and applications underlying the statistical analysis of environmental data in the space time and spectral domain.

CETL.name: Graduate Teaching Assistant Preparation
CETL.description: This course is an introduction to the procedural information and practical skills needed to be an effective graduate teaching assistant.

CETL.name: Classroom Management and Policies: Effective Teaching
CETL.description: A course in which students learn about official Georgia Tech policies impacting instruction and develop skills to resolve problems and enhance classroom learning.

CETL.name: Student and Teacher Enhancement Partnership Summer Training
CETL.description: Participants attend training sessions on pedagogy classroom management educational technology engage in practice teaching and design action plans for partnering with local high school teachers.

CETL.name: STEP Fellows Academic Year Seminar
CETL.description: This is the academic year follow-up course for STEP fellows.  It is a forum to share and to continue training as the fellows work in their STEP high schools.

CETL.name: Fundamentals of Teaching and Learning in Higher Education
CETL.description: This course explores how to apply evidence-based teaching practices in higher education including principles of learning student development inclusive teaching and instructional strategies..

CETL.name: Teach Practicum-HigherEd
CETL.description: Apprentice to faculty mentor and help teach a college course.  Get feedback from mentor CETL and a peer learning community.  Explore types of academic careers.

CETL.name: Teach Practicum-HigherEd
CETL.description: Apprentice to faculty mentor and help teach a college course. Get feedback from mentor CETL and a peer learning community.  Explore types of academic careers.

CETL.name: Course Design for Higher Education
CETL.description: This course examines evidence-based teaching formative and summative assessment and educational technology as students apply the backward design process in developing a college course.

CETL.name: Teaching Capstone in Higher Education
CETL.description: Students apply evidence-based teaching and backward design principles student assessment peer and mentor feedback through supervised college teaching in this Tech to Teaching certificate capstone.

CETL.name: Academic Writing for Graduate Students and
CETL.description: Through examination of writing samples and practice students learn techniques for enhancing proposal preparation and methods for evaluating writing as future instructors and thesis directors.

CETL.name: Academic Writing for International Graduate Students
CETL.description: This course aids international graduate students in enhancing their academic writing skills in English through exposure to and practice of producing examples of academic writing. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL8722 and CETL8723.

CETL.name: Academic Writing for International Graduate Students
CETL.description: This course helps international graduate students enhance their academic writing skills in English through analysis and production of academic writing samples. Credit not awarded for both CETL8723 and CETL8722.

CETL.name: Academic Professionalism
CETL.description: Participants in this course work through numerous exercises and scenarios in order to prepare them professionally and personally for a future career in academics.

CETL.name: Academic Presentations
CETL.description: An examination and practice of oral presentations in a variety of academic scenarios e.g. conference talks proposal presentations discussion facilitation job talks and oral exams/defenses.

CETL.name: Instructional Practices for International
CETL.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation and instructional skills for international teaching assistants.  In-class and small-group language practice discussion of teaching methodology.

CETL.name: Classroom English and Pedagogy for International
CETL.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation and instructional skills for international teaching assistants.  In-class and small-group language practice discussion of teaching methodology individual tutoring.

CETL.name: Classroom English for International Graduate Students
CETL.description: An oral skills class designed to help graduate students become more accurate and fluent in both verbal and nonverbal skills. In addition to working on acquiring an American accent and body language when speaking English students will work on basic presentation skills. Credit will not be awarded for CETL8793 and CETL8797.

CETL.name: Academic English for International Graduate Students
CETL.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation for international teaching assistants.  In-class and small group language practice.

CETL.name: Advanced Oral Skills for International Graduate Students and Teaching Assistants
CETL.description: An advanced oral skills class designed to help graduate students improve their verbal ability in English for teaching making presentations and interacting in academic and professional situations. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL8796 and CETL8795.

CETL.name: Presentation Skills for International Graduate Students
CETL.description: This advanced oral skills class is designed to help graduate students improve their presentation skills in English for more effective communication in academic/professinal situations. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL8795 and CETL8796.

CETL.name: Oral Communication for International Graduate Students
CETL.description: In this class students work on fluency pronunciation clarity and appropriateness in spoken communication to prepare for effective and confident participation in their academic communities. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL8797 and CETL8793.

CETL.name: Special Problems
CETL.description: Special problems in current interest.

CETL.name: Student and Teacher Enhancement Partnership
CETL.description: This course if for STEP students with an assistantship.

CHBE.name: Introduction to Bioengineering
CHBE.description: An introduction to the field of bioengineering including the application of engineering principles and methods to problems in biology and medicine the integration of engineering with biology and the emerging industrial opportunities. Crosslisted with AE BMED ECE ME and MSE1750.

CHBE.name: Special Topics
CHBE.description: Special Topics in CHBE.

CHBE.name: Chemical Process Principles
CHBE.description: Material and energy balances for single-phase and multi-phase processes common to chemical engineering. Phase equilibrium and analysis of reacting systems.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics I
CHBE.description: Elements of engineering thermodynamics. First and second laws. Analysis of engineering machinery compressors turbines engines refrigeration.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE2110 and  CHBE2130.

CHBE.name: Numerical Methods in Chemical Engineering
CHBE.description: Numerical methods are introduced and applied to the solution of chemical engineering problems. An introduction to chemical process simulation and the appropriate software is provided.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering  Thermodynamics I
CHBE.description: Basic principles of chemical engineering thermodynamics including first and second laws equations of state PVT properties power cycles and refrigeration.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE2130 and CHBE2110.

CHBE.name: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
CHBE.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE.name: Undergraduate Research
CHBE.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE.name: Special Topics
CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.name: CHBE 2801 Recitation
CHBE.description: Designed to provide time for application of conceptual knowledge and extension of instruction. Optional and non-billable.

CHBE.name: Special Topics
CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics II
CHBE.description: Phase and chemical reaction equilibria. Vapor-liquid liquid-liquid and solid-vapor phase equilibrium Fugacity and activity coefficients. Multi-reaction equilibrium.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE3110 and CHBE3130.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics II
CHBE.description: Basic principles of chemical engineering solution and phase equilibrium thermodynamics including ideal and non-ideal solution models and phase equilibira calculations (VLE SLE LLE).  Credit not allowed for both CHBE3130 and CHBE3110.

CHBE.name: Transport Process I
CHBE.description: Fundamentals of fluid mechanics and heat transfer. The design and analysis of equipment using the principles of fluid mechanics and heat transfer.

CHBE.name: Transport Processes II
CHBE.description: Fundamental principles and applications of mass transfer. The analysis of chemical engineering processes and operations involving mass transfer.

CHBE.name: Separations Processes
CHBE.description: Fundamentals of equilibrium-stage and continuous contacting operations.  Applications of principles to distillation absorption/stripping extraction absorption and other separation technologies.

CHBE.name: Engineering Ethics and Leadership
CHBE.description: Development of quantitative and qualitative assessment tools to resolve moral and ethical dilemmas that arise in the performance of engineering duties.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering in Nanoscale Systems
CHBE.description: Application of chemical processing fundamentals fabrication and characterization to design and analyze technologically important nanoscale systems. The course emphasizes an integrated engineering and science approach.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering of Energy Systems
CHBE.description: Students will acquire the knowledge and tools to analyze CHP systems traditional power generation refinery and biorefinery configurations and advanced power generation and storage options.

CHBE.name: The Science and Engineering of Microelectronic Fabrication
CHBE.description: An elective class for students interested in fabrication of semiconductor devices focusing on the fundamentals of materials synthesis chemical and mechanical properties and chemical reactions. Credit will not be awarded for both CHBE4050 and CHBE6050.

CHBE.name: Transport Phenomena/Unit Operations Laboratory
CHBE.description: This course illustrates engineering/scientific principles and physical models important to the data collection/ interpretation of processes important to the practice of chemical engineering.

CHBE.name: Transport Phenomena / Bioprocess Unit Operations
CHBE.description: This course illustrates engineering/scientific principles and physical models important to the data collection/interpretation of processes important in biotechnology.

CHBE.name: Kinetics and Reactor Design
CHBE.description: Reacting systems are analyzed in terms of reaction mechanisms kinetics and reactor design.  Both homogeneous and heterogeneous reactions are considered.

CHBE.name: Bioprocess Engineering
CHBE.description: Integrating several ChBE core concepts bioprocess engineering applies the material to biological systems. Items covered are enzyme kinetics fermentation downstream processing and integrated bioprocesses important to the biotech industries.

CHBE.name: Chemical Process Control
CHBE.description: Dynamics of chemical processes and their control. Techniques of conventional process control as well as digital control. Laboratory experiments to illustrate these concepts.

CHBE.name: Process Dynamics and Control
CHBE.description: Dynamics of chemical processes and their control. Techniques of conventional process control as well as digital control.

CHBE.name: Process Dynamics and Control Laboratory
CHBE.description: Dynamics of chemical processes and their control. Techniques of conventional process control as well as digital control. Laboratory experiments would illustrate these concepts.

CHBE.name: Process Design and Economics
CHBE.description: Principles of flowsheet synthesis and economic analysis and optimization.  A complete design on a chemical process will be undertaken including concepts of unit operations design economics and safety.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE4505 and CHBE4530 (or CHBE4520).

CHBE.name: Process and Product Design And Economics
CHBE.description: Basic principles of chemical process and product design including heuristic design approaches heat exchanger network design optimization and economic evaluation.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE4510 and CHBE4505 (or CHBE4525).

CHBE.name: Chemical Process Safety
CHBE.description: Fundamental sources of chemical hazards and degree of risk.  Process design and hazard avoidance are used to reduce risk.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering Capstone Design Project
CHBE.description: Basic principles of chemical process and product design including heuristic design approaches heat exchanger network design optimization and economic evaluation.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE4520 and CHBE4505 (or CHBE4525).

CHBE.name: Bioprocess Design and Economics
CHBE.description: Principles of flowsheet synthesis and economic analysis and optimization. A complete design of a biochemical process will be undertaken including concepts of unit operations design economics and safety.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE4525 and CHBE4530 (or CHBE4520).

CHBE.name: Capstone ChBE Bio-Design
CHBE.description: Basic principles of chemical process and product design including heuristic design approaches heat exchanger network design optimization and economic evaluation.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE4530 and CHBE4505 (or 4525).

CHBE.name: Chemical Product Design, Engineering and Optimization
CHBE.description: Chemical engineering principles applied to the design of products.

CHBE.name: Pulping and Bleaching Laboratory
CHBE.description: Experiments of pulping bleaching fiber and chemical testing are performed.  Hands-on experience from chip preparation cooking pulp processing and bleaching are provided.

CHBE.name: Papermaking and Recycled Pulp Laboratory
CHBE.description: Experiments of pulp preparation refining paperforming handsheet testing deinking and recycled pulp processing are performed. Small paper machine operation will be taught.

CHBE.name: Effective Communication for Professional Engineering
CHBE.description: How engineers communicate with engineering and non-engineering professionals.  Industry speakers from different fields.  Engineering case study. Weekly written and/or oral presentations.

CHBE.name: Complex Fluids - Microstructure and Mechanical Properties
CHBE.description: Complex fluids have interesting practically relevant mechanical properties that arise from complex microstructures. This course covers fundamental physical principles experimental characterization techniques and current topics.

CHBE.name: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
CHBE.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE.name: Undergraduate Research
CHBE.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

CHBE.name: Pulp and Paper Manufacturing
CHBE.description: The course provides comprehensive foundational knowledge of the industry enabling the student to understand the role of diverse manufacturing operations and to strategically plan improvements.

CHBE.name: Emerging Technologies for Forest Bioproducts
CHBE.description: The course provides comprehensive knowledge of the manufacture of nontraditional products from forest biomaterials. It analyzes and assesses emerging manufacturing technologies materials and products.

CHBE.name: Fundamentals and Challenges for a Sustainable Chemical Enterprise
CHBE.description: Life Cycle Inventory methodology will be explored as a means to develop new sustainable products materials and manufacturing processes.

CHBE.name: Data Analytics for Chemical Engineers
CHBE.description: Introduction to data analytics and machine learning techniques for chemical engineers. Application of basic regression classification dimensional reduction and clustering techniques to chemical data sets.

CHBE.name: Data-Driven Process Systems Engineering
CHBE.description: This course covers theory of optimization and data-driven modeling methods and examples of data-driven decision-making in the chemical process industry.

CHBE.name: Integrated Circuit Fabrication
CHBE.description: The objective of this course is to give students exposure to the various steps involved in the fabrication of integrated circuits and devices.  This course will include a laboratory segment in which students fabricate MOS transistors diffused resistors and MOS capacitors from a bare silicon substrate.  Crosslisted with ECE4752.

CHBE.name: Electronic Packaging Substrate Fabrication
CHBE.description: This course provides hands-on instruction in basic packaging substrate fabrication techniques including interconnect design and testing dielectric deposition via formation and metallization. Crosslisted with ECE4755.

CHBE.name: Biofluid Mechanics
CHBE.description: Introduction to the study of blood flow in the cardiovascular system. Emphasis on modeling and the potential of flow studies for clinical research application. Crosslisted with AE and ME4757.

CHBE.name: Biosolid Mechanics
CHBE.description: The mechanics of living tissue e.g. arteries skin heart muscle ligament tendon cartilage and bone. Constitutive equations and some simple mechanical models. Mechanics of cells. Applications. Crosslisted with AE and ME4758.

CHBE.name: Electrochemical Energy Storage and Conversion
CHBE.description: An elective class for senior-level students interested in electrochemical storage and covnersion including the fundamentals of electrochemistry and practical battery and fuel cells.

CHBE.name: Biocatalysis and Metabolic Engineering
CHBE.description: This course provides an in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts their functioning in metabolic networks their application in various industries recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHEM4760.

CHBE.name: Protein Engineering
CHBE.description: This course covers the theory and practice of protein engineering methods including specific examples of engineered proteins and their applications from the literature.

CHBE.name: Pulping and Chemical Recovery
CHBE.description: Pulping and chemical recovery processes are studied on the reaction delignification energy and liquor reuse.  The process optimization air and water pollution minimization are taught. Crosslisted with ME4763.

CHBE.name: Bleaching and Papermaking
CHBE.description: Pulp bleaching and formation of paper/board products are studied along with testing end uses chemical and mechanical treatment of pulp non-wood and recycled fiber utilization. Crosslisted with ME4764.

CHBE.name: Drug Design, Development and Delivery
CHBE.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process including design of new drugs synthesis and manufacturing issues and methods for delivery into the body. Includes student presentations. Crosslisted with CHEM and BMED4765.

CHBE.name: Pulp And Paper Lab
CHBE.description: Fundamentals of pulp and paper testing procedures.

CHBE.name: Nuclear Chemical Engineering
CHBE.description: This course surveys the chemical engineering aspects of nuclear power.  Topics include nuclear reactions fuel cycles solvent extraction of metals the properties of actinides and other irradiated fuel materials fuel reprocessing and radioactive waste management.  Crosslisted with NRE4770.

CHBE.name: Polymer Science and Engineering I: Formation and Properties
CHBE.description: An introduction to the chemistry structure and formation of polymers physical states and transitions physical and mechanical properties to polymer fluids and solids. Crosslisted with CHEM ME MSE and PTFE 4775.

CHBE.name: Polymer Science and Engineering II: Analysis, Processing and Laboratory
CHBE.description: Polymer fabrication processes and methods of characterization and identification of polymers are presented. Experiments in polymerization processing and property evaluation of polymers.  Crosslisted with CHEM ME MSE and TFE 4776.

CHBE.name: Biomedical Instrumentation
CHBE.description: A study of medical instrumentation from a systems viewpoint. Pertinent physiological and electro-physiological concepts will be covered. Credit not allowed for both CHBE4781 and (CHE 4781 or ECE4781 or BMED4781 or ME4781).

CHBE.name: Biosystems Analysis
CHBE.description: Analytical methods for modeling biological systems including white-noise protocols for characterizing nonlinear systems. Crosslisted with BMED ECE and ME4782.

CHBE.name: Mechanical Behavior of Composites
CHBE.description: Stress-strain behavior of composites property of matrix and reinforcing materials mechanics of fiber-reinforced composites lamina and laminate analysis and mechanical performance. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME MSE and PTFE 4791.

CHBE.name: Composite Materials and Processes
CHBE.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME MSE and PTFE 4793.

CHBE.name: Composite Materials and Manufacturing
CHBE.description: Basic principles of selection and design of composite materials and their manufacturing and testing. Cost factors. Laboratory exercises on manufacturing and tests. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME MSE and PTFE 4794.

CHBE.name: Special Topics
CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.name: Special Topics
CHBE.description: Topics relevant to chemical engineering not currently covered in the undergraduate curriculum are presented as demand or interest warrants.

CHBE.name: Special Problems
CHBE.description: The student is given an opportunity to develop initiative and to apply fundamental principles by doing semioriginal laboratory or theoretical investigation of a chemical engineering problem.

CHBE.name: Special Problems
CHBE.description: The student is given an opportunity to develop initiative and to apply fundamental principles by doing semioriginal laboratory or theoretical investigation of a chemical engineering problem.

CHBE.name: Special Problems
CHBE.description: The student is given an opportunity to develop initiative and to apply fundamental principles by doing semioriginal laboratory or theoretical investigation of a chemical engineering problem.

CHBE.name: Introdcution to Research and Resposible Conduct of Research for ChBE Graduate Students
CHBE.description: This course introduces ChBE graduate students to topics that will be encountered in research and fulfills RCR (responsible conduct of reseach) in-person training requirements.

CHBE.name: Chemical Process Safety
CHBE.description: The course focuses on risk reduction through design and hazard avoidance.  Sources of chemical hazards and risks are discussed.

CHBE.name: Communication Skills for Technical Problem Solving
CHBE.description: Applications of both written and oral communication skills to the solution of technical problems.  Includes focus audience analysis visual aids and organization.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering in Nanoscale Systems
CHBE.description: Application of chemical processing fundamentals fabrication and characterization to design and analyze technologically important nanoscale systems.  The course emphasizes an integrated engineering and science approach.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering of Energy Systems
CHBE.description: Students will acquire the knowledge and tools to analyze CHP systems traditional power generation refinery and biorefinery configurations and advanced power generation and storage options.

CHBE.name: The Science and Engineering of Microelectronic Fabrication
CHBE.description: An elective class for students interested in fabrication of semiconductor devices focusing on the fundamentals of materials synthesis chemical and mechanical properties and chemical reactions. Credit will not be awarded for both CHBE6050 and CHBE4050.

CHBE.name: Advanced Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics
CHBE.description: Equations of state corresponding states and activity coefficient models and their relationship to intermolecular forces.  Phase and chemical equilibria in chemical engineering.

CHBE.name: Thermodynamics of Systems of Large Molecules
CHBE.description: Classical and statistical thermodynamics of systems that are important in chemical biochemical and polymer processing.

CHBE.name: Molecular Modeling
CHBE.description: Introduction to computational chemistry techniques for modeling substances at the molecular level including ab initio and semiempirical quantum methods molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo methods.

CHBE.name: Electrochemical Engineering
CHBE.description: Electrochemical thermodynamics and kinetics. Corrosion. Applications to semiconductor devices fuel cells and batteries.

CHBE.name: Advanced Transport Phenomena, Fluid Mechanics, and Heat
CHBE.description: Transfer Viscous fluid mechanics and convective heat transfer. Scaling analysis and lubrication. Stokes and boundary layer flows.  Transport about solid bodies. Linear stability theory.

CHBE.name: Fluid Mechanics of Two-Phase Flow
CHBE.description: Two-phase flow of nondeformable particles in Newtonian fluids.  Rigorous results in the limit of small Reynolds number motions and applications to suspensions and colloids.

CHBE.name: Computational Fluid Dynamics: Applications in Environmental
CHBE.description: Applications in Environmental and Chemical Processes. Introduction to numerical methods for solving transport problems.  Applications to problems of interest in environmental and chemical processes.

CHBE.name: Introduction to MEMS
CHBE.description: Introduction to Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems  Microfabrication techniques including photolithography etching physical and chemical vapor deposition electroplating bonding and polymer processing.  Application to sensors and actuators.

CHBE.name: Industrial Emissions Control
CHBE.description: Analysis of air quality criteria ambient and emission standards and industrial pollution sources.  Recovery and utilization of waste gases and particulate matter.

CHBE.name: Environmental Modeling in the Forest Products Industry
CHBE.description: The science and engineering of waste treatment processes in the pulp and paper industry.

CHBE.name: Chemical Engineering Processes in Pulp & Paper Manufacturing
CHBE.description: To study the details of some of the major unit operations in pulp and paper manufacturing.

CHBE.name: Advanced Separation Processes
CHBE.description: This course provides an advanced analysis of separation process technology with special emphasis on new separation techniques and their applications.

CHBE.name: Mass Transport through Solids
CHBE.description: An in-depth introduction to transport of penetrants in and through solids.  Convective flow through porous media and conductive flow through homogenous solids.  Membrane separations.

CHBE.name: Transport Phenomena-Mass Transfer
CHBE.description: Mass transport processes and material properties that affect them.  Principles of both steady- and unsteady-state molecular diffusion are developed and transfer mechanisms examined.

CHBE.name: Kinetics and Reactor Design
CHBE.description: A study of chemical kinetics and mechanisms in complex homogeneous and heterogeneous reaction systems. Design and analysis of chemical reactors for such systems.

CHBE.name: Applied Chemical Kinetics
CHBE.description: Applications of chemical kinetics to homogeneous and heterogeneous gas and liquid reactions including techniques and analyses.

CHBE.name: Heterogeneous Catalysis
CHBE.description: Physics and chemistry of surfaces thermodynamics kinetics and mechanism of adsorption and surface reactions modern instrumental analyses and industrial catalysis.

CHBE.name: Advanced Process Control
CHBE.description: Fundamentals of multivariate control theory as applied to chemical processes.

CHBE.name: Dynamic Behavior of Process Systems
CHBE.description: Introduction to process dynamics.  Modeling of lumped systems with and without chemical reactions.  Lumped processes involving phase equilibrium. Distributed parameter systems.  Optimization of transient processes.

CHBE.name: Microelectromechanical Devices
CHBE.description: Introduces fundamental concepts and tools needed for the design simulation and analysis of MEMS devices.  These include electrical mechanical radiant thermal magnetic and chemical domains.  Credit not allowed for both CHBE6460 and ME6460 or ECE6460.

CHBE.name: Mathematical Modeling and Analysis of Chemical Processes
CHBE.description: Formulation and solution of mathematical models of a range of chemical processes with an emphasis on differential balances and incorporation of uncertainty.

CHBE.name: Polymerization Reaction Engineering
CHBE.description: Polymerization processes are analyzed with regard to reaction mechanism kinetics and reactor design.  Control of polymer structure during polymerization is emphasized.

CHBE.name: Semiconductor Microlithography and Patterning
CHBE.description: The study of fundamental issues from physics chemistry chemical engineering and electrical engineering inherent in semiconductor microlithography encompassing both materials and processes used for pattern definition.

CHBE.name: Polymers in Microelectronics
CHBE.description: Use of polymers in microelectronics applications such as photolithography interlevel dielectrics encapsulation packaging magnetic media and optical storage.

CHBE.name: Complex Fluids - Microstructure and Mechanical Properties
CHBE.description: Complex fluids have interesting practically relevant mechanical properties that arise from complex microstructures. This course covers fundamental physical principles experimental characterization techniques and current topics.

CHBE.name: Wet End Processing of Paper
CHBE.description: Wet end colloidal and polymer science of papermaking processes.  Processing with fiber mineral fillers brighteners and polymer additives.

CHBE.name: Foundational Topics in the Manufacturing of Forest Bioproducts
CHBE.description: The course provides comprehensive foundational knowledge of the industry enabling the student to understand the role of diverse manufacturing operations and to strategically plan improvements.  Course is cross-listed with MLDR6701 CHBE6741 ME6741 CHEM 6741 MSE 6741 CHBE6742 ME6742 CHEM 6742 MSE 6742.

CHBE.name: Microfluidics & Appl
CHBE.description: This course explores the fundamentals of microfluidics and nanofluidics and their applications primarily in biological and medical sciences (e.g. biomolecular separations).  Credit not allowed for both CHBE6710 and CHBE4710.

CHBE.name: Pulp and Paper Manufacture I
CHBE.description: The fundamentals of pulp and paper technology are presented. Applications to the several unit operations used are explored and augmented by field trips and recent case studies. Crosslisted with ME6741 CHBE6701 and MLDR6701.

CHBE.name: Pulp and Paper Manufacture II
CHBE.description: Papermaking technology is covered from a multidisciplinary engineering perspective with fundamental and practical considerations being addressed. Students participate in groups to run a pilot papermaking trial at the Henry Foundation in Savannah. Crosslisted with ME6741 CHBE6701 and MLDR6701.

CHBE.name: Fundamentals and Challenges for a Sustainable Chemical Enterprise
CHBE.description: Life Cycle Inventory methodology will be explored as a means to develop new sustainable products materials and manufacturing processes.

CHBE.name: Data Analytics for Chemical Engineers
CHBE.description: Introduction to data analytics and machine learning techniques for chemical engineers. Application of basic regression classification dimensional reduction and clustering techniques to chemical data sets.

CHBE.name: Data-Driven Process Systems Engineering
CHBE.description: This course covers theory of optimization and data-driven modeling methods and examples of data-driven decision-making in the chemical process industry.

CHBE.name: Preparation and Reactions of Polymers
CHBE.description: A detailed treatment of the reactions involved in the synthesis of both human-made and natural polymers including preparation and degradative reactions of polymer systems. Crosslisted with CHEM and PTFE 6750.

CHBE.name: Physical Chemistry of Polymer Solutions
CHBE.description: Study of polymer solutions polymer miscibility adsorption sorption plasticization molecular weights molecular weight distributions and interfacial phenomena using thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Crosslisted with CHEM MSE and PTFE 6751.

CHBE.name: Polymer Characterization
CHBE.description: This course introduces the student to surface near-surface and structural methods of polymer characterization. Specialized techniques critical to physical structure are emphasized. Crosslisted with CHEM MSE and PTFE 6752.

CHBE.name: Plasma Processing of Electronic Materials and Devices
CHBE.description: Fundamental physics chemistry chemical engineering and electrical engineering principles inherent in plasma processes. Includes etching deposition diagnostic methods and control schemes. Crosslisted with ECE6759.

CHBE.name: Biocatalysis and Metabolic Engineering
CHBE.description: This course provides in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts their functioning in metabolic networks their application in various industries and recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHEM6760.

CHBE.name: Protein Engineering
CHBE.description: This course covers the theory and practice of protein engineering methods including specific examples of engineered proteins and their applications from the literature.

CHBE.name: Drug Design, Development and Delivery
CHBE.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process including design of new drugs synthesis and manufacturing issues and methods of delivery into the body. Includes student presentations.  Crosslisted with BMED6765 and CHBE6765.

CHBE.name: Polymer Structure, Physical Properties and Characterization
CHBE.description: Formulations and analysis of molecular and phenomenological models of elastic and viscoelastic behavior development and description of structure and fundamental aspects of structure-property relations.  Crosslisted with ME PTFE and MSE6768.

CHBE.name: Biomaterials: Structure and Function
CHBE.description: Structure-function relationships of biomaterials and biomaterial characterization will be covered. Materials for medical implants tissue engineering biosensing imaging and drug delivery will be covered. Crosslisted with BMED ME and MSE6774.

CHBE.name: Advanced Biomaterials
CHBE.description: Advanced topics of biomaterials performance and engineering including biointerfaces host reactions of materials and bio-inspired/smart-materials strategies. Crosslisted with BMED ME and MSE6777.

CHBE.name: Introduction to Biomaterials
CHBE.description: Introduction to a variety of biomaterials and their biomedical applications. Crosslisted with BMED and PTFE 6778.

CHBE.name: Bioprocess Engineering
CHBE.description: Study of enzymes and microbial and mammalian cells for production of biochemicals and protein therapeutics in bioreactors downstream separation and purification integrated view of bioprocesses. Crosslisted with BMED6779.

CHBE.name: Cellular Engineering
CHBE.description: Engineering analysis of cellular systems. Crosslisted with BMED and ME6782.

CHBE.name: Cardiovascular Biomechanics
CHBE.description: Mechanical analysis of the cardiovascular system emphasizing the normal and pathologic function in relation to clinical cardiovascular medicine. Crosslisted with BMED and ME 6784.

CHBE.name: Technology Ventures
CHBE.description: Team discussion and case studies in biomedical engineering technology transfer including licensing financial capital safety and efficacy studies clinical trials and strategic planning. Crosslisted with BMED ECE ME and MGT6789.

CHBE.name: Systems Pathophysiology
CHBE.description: Overview of human pathophysiology from a quantitative perspective.  A brief introduction to the application of quantitative models to the understanding of biological systems. Crosslisted with BMED ECE and ME6793.

CHBE.name: Tissue Engineering
CHBE.description: Biological engineering and medical issues in developing tissue-engineered constructs.  Emphasis on the integration of these disciplines at a basic molecular and cell biology level.  Crosslisted with CHE and ME6794.

CHBE.name: Legal Issues in Technology Transfer
CHBE.description: Study and analysis of U.S. law as it applies to the patenting and licensing processes.  Crosslisted with BMED ME and MGT6799.

CHBE.name: Pharmaceutical development: from drug lead to drug product
CHBE.description: We address the multifaceted process of bringing a drug from concept to market through open-ended student-driven collaborative projects addressing real-world problems in pharmaceutical development.

CHBE.name: Advanced Physical Chemistry of Polymers
CHBE.description: Thermodynamics and microscopic dynamics of polymers. Fundamental concepts including scaling concepts governing anisotropy of polarizability phase transitions morphology time-dependent correlations etc.

CHBE.name: Teaching Practicum
CHBE.description: Supervised teaching for doctoral students.  Teaching techniques course and curriculum design student evaluation methods and criteria.  Students may in some instances prepare and present lectures.  Crosslisted with NRE ME HP7757.

CHBE.name: Mechanics of Polymer Solids and Fluids
CHBE.description: Continuum mechanics of solids and fluids mechanics of deformation of anisotropic polymers yield breaking and fatigue non-Newtonian viscous and viscoelastic behavior of polymer fluids. Crosslisted with ME MSE and PTFE 7771.

CHBE.name: Fundamentals of Fracture Mechanics
CHBE.description: Advanced study of failure of structural materials under load mechanics of fracture and microscopic and macroscopic aspects of the fracture of engineering materials. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME and MSE7772.

CHBE.name: Advanced Fracture Mechanics
CHBE.description: Nonlinear fracture mechanics including elastic-plastic and time-dependent fracture advanced test methods J-integral theory and extensions.  Crosslisted with AE CEE ME and MSE7773.

CHBE.name: Fatigue of Materials and Structures
CHBE.description: Mechanical and microstructural aspects of nucleation and growth of cracks under cyclic loading conditions notch effects cumulative damage multiaxial loading and fatigue crack propagation.  Crosslisted with AE CEE ME and MSE7774.

CHBE.name: Topics in Fracture and Fatigue of Metallic and Composite
CHBE.description: Structures Brittle and ductile failure criteria. Failure prediction in composite structures. Free-edge and internal delamination. Anisotropic cracks. Fatigue behavior of composites and comparison with metal fatigue. Crosslisted with AE ME and MSE7775.

CHBE.name: Damage, Failure, and Durability of Composite Materials
CHBE.description: Provides knowledge of the fundamental concepts and methods related to analysis and assessment of damage failure and durability of composite materials. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME MSE and PTFE 7791.

CHBE.name: Advanced Mechanics of Composites
CHBE.description: Anisotropic elasticity failure theories hydrothermal behavior 3-D analysis of laminates thick laminates free- edge effects stress concentrations joints creep and fracture of composites and advanced topics. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME MSE and PTFE 7792.

CHBE.name: Manufacturing of Composites
CHBE.description: Major manufacturing techniques for metal ceramic and polymer matrix composites.  Modeling of processes with emphasis on fundamental mechanisms and effects. Crosslisted with AE CEE ME MSE and PTFE 7793.

CHBE.name: Teaching Assistantship
CHBE.description: For graduate students holding teaching assistantships.

CHBE.name: Research Assistantship
CHBE.description: For graduate students holding research assistantships.

CHEM.name: Chemical Principles I
CHEM.description: Topics to be covered include atomic structure bonding properties of matter thermodynamics and physical equilibria.  Laboratory exercises supplement the lecture material.  Credit not allowed for both CHEM1310 and CHEM1211K.

CHEM.name: Chemical Principles II
CHEM.description: Topics to be covered include chemical equilibria acids and bases aqueous equilibria electrochemistry kinetics main group and transition elements.  Laboratory exercises supplement the lecture material.  Credit not allowed for CHEM 1311/1312 and CHEM1212K.

CHEM.name: General Chemistry
CHEM.description: Fundamental laws and theories of chemical reactions. Topics include atomic structure bonding theory stoichiometry properties of solids liquids and gases chemical thermodynamics electrochemistry and kinetics. Credit not allowed for both CHEM1211K and CHEM1310.

CHEM.name: Survey of Organic Chemistry
CHEM.description: Survey of organic chemistry as the basis for biochemical processes and commercial applications.

CHEM.name: Introduction to Quantitative Analysis
CHEM.description: Laboratory experimentation emphasizing quantitative chemical analysis.  Credit not allowed for both CHEM2211 and CHEM 1313.

CHEM.name: Quantitative Chemical Analysis
CHEM.description: Theory and laboratory of quantitative chemical analysis.

CHEM.name: Organic and Bioorganic Chemistry
CHEM.description: A second course in organic chemistry that extends the study to topics in biochemistry.

CHEM.name: Synthesis Laboratory I
CHEM.description: Methods for preparation isolation and characterization of complex organic molecules natural products and polymers.

CHEM.name: Synthesis Laboratory I

CHEM.name: Professional Skills for Chemists and Biochemists
CHEM.description: An introduction to technical and communication skills utilized in upper level chemistry and biochemistry courses with additional focus on resume building and professional development.

CHEM.description: Multi-step organic synthesis and inorganic synthesis. Use of chemical literature and advanced spectroscopic techniques.

CHEM.name: Synthesis Laboratory II
CHEM.description: Multi-step organic and inorganic synthesis.  Use of the chemical literature and advanced spectroscopic techniques.

CHEM.name: Physical Chemistry I

CHEM.name: Physical Chemistry II
CHEM.description: Quantum mechanics atomic and molecular structure bonding theory molecular spectroscopy statistical mechanics.

CHEM.description: Laboratory investigations of physical principles applied to chemical systems.

CHEM.name: Physical Chemistry Laboratory II
CHEM.description: Laboratory investigations of physical principles applied to chemical systems.

CHEM.description: Introductory course in biochemistry dealing with the chemistry and biochemistry of proteins lipids carbohydrates nucleic acids and other biomolecules.

CHEM.name: The Science of Alternative Energy
CHEM.description: Scientific principles governing the current and future approaches in solar photo-voltaics fuel cells biomass conversion nuclear energy and wind power.

CHEM.description: Special Topics in Chemistry.

CHEM.name: Applications of Inorganic Chemistry in Current Energy Research
CHEM.description: The principles of coordination chemistry applied to theories and mechanisms of energy conversion and storage in chemistry and biology. Students cannot receive credit for CHEM4113 and CHEM6171.

CHEM.name: Advanced Organic Chemistry
CHEM.description: Construction reactions and functional group interconversions as applied to multistep organic synthesis.

CHEM.name: Applied Spectroscopy
CHEM.description: Theory and application of NMR mass spectrometry and infrared spectroscopy in the determination of organic structures.

CHEM.name: Molecular Spectroscopy
CHEM.description: Introduction to the theory and applications of molecular spectroscopy including electronic vibrational rotational transitions and selections rules.

CHEM.name: Chemistry of the Solid State
CHEM.description: Application of the concepts of physical and inorganic chemistry to the structure of solids and their chemical and physical properties.

CHEM.name: Biochemistry I
CHEM.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins lipids carbohydrates nucleic acids and other biomolecules.

CHEM.name: Biochemistry II

CHEM.name: Biophysical Chemistry
CHEM.description: The physical chemistry of biological systems biological macromolecules and biological aggregates.

CHEM.name: Biochemistry Laboratory I
CHEM.description: Modern biochemical techniques including methods for protein nucleic acid and lipid isolation and characterization enzyme assays chromatography electrophoresis and use of databases.

CHEM.name: Biochemistry Laboratory II
CHEM.description: Laboratory techniques in the isolation and characterization of biological molecules with special emphasis on modern techniques.

CHEM.name: Chemistry Seminar
CHEM.description: Student presentations of recent research topics in chemistry or biochemistry based on lab experience and/or literature searches.

CHEM.name: Advanced Chemistry Lab
CHEM.description: A modular laboratory involving a series of multipart experiments that build upon chemical principles and experimental techniques introduced in earlier courses and instructional laboratories. Credit not allowed for both CHEM4684 and CHEM 4681.

CHEM.name: Atmospheric Chemistry
CHEM.description: This course provides a general chemical description of the Earths atmospheric system with a major focus on the two lowest layers of the atmosphere i.e. the troposphere and the stratosphere. Crosslisted with EAS4740.

CHEM.name: Biocatalysis and Metabolic Engineering
CHEM.description: This course provides an in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts their functioning in metabolic networks their application in various industries recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHBE4760.

CHEM.name: Drug Design, Development, and Delivery
CHEM.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process including design of new drugs synthesis and manufacturing issues and methods for delivery into the body. Includes student presentations. Crosslisted with CHBE and BMED4765.

CHEM.name: Polymer Science and Engineering I: Formation and Properties
CHEM.description: An introduction to the chemistry structure and formation of polymers physical states and transitions physical and mechanical properties of polymer fluids and solids. Crosslisted with CHE ME MSE and PTFE 4775.

CHEM.name: Polymer Science and Engineering II: Analysis, Processing, and Laboratory
CHEM.description: Polymer fabrication processes and methods of characterization and identification of polymers are presented. Experiments in polymerization processing and property evaluation of polymers. Crosslisted with CHE ME MSE and TFE 4776.

CHEM.name: Inorganic Chemistry I
CHEM.description: A series of key topics in inorganic chemistry will be reviewed acids/bases redox processes bonding and structure transition metal chemistry coordination complexes.

CHEM.name: Inorganic Chemistry II
CHEM.description: Contemporary topics in inorganic chemistry including bioinorganic chemistry reaction mechanisms and kinetics optical and magnetic properties of molecular species and inorganic materials.

CHEM.name: Physical Methods in Inorganic Chemistry
CHEM.description: An introduction to the use of physical methods in inorganic chemistry including vibrational spectroscopy multinuclear NMR EST Mossbauer magnetometery NQR PES diffraction and EXAFS.

CHEM.name: Chemical Crystallography
CHEM.description: The collection and interpretation of diffraction data. Single crystal structure analysis powder diffraction for phase identification and quantitative analysis and Rietveld refinement.

CHEM.name: Chemistry of the Solid State
CHEM.description: An introduction to the chemistry of the solid state. Synthetic methods measurement of properties structure of solids theory of electrical optical and magnetic properties.

CHEM.name: Organometallic Chemistry
CHEM.description: The chemistry of main group and transition metal organometallics.  Including synthetic methods homogeneous catalysis and catalytic cycles and synthetically useful organometallic reagents.

CHEM.name: Analytical Chemistry I
CHEM.description: Discussion of chemical equilibrium separations and bioanalytical methods.

CHEM.name: Analytical Chemistry II
CHEM.description: Topics include experimental design electronics and spectroscopy.

CHEM.name: Mass Spectrometry
CHEM.description: Topics include sample handling ionization methods MS/MS and quantitative analysis.

CHEM.name: Chemical Sensors
CHEM.description: Origins of selectivity principles of transduction mechanisms construction and applications of modern chemical sensors.

CHEM.name: Electroanalytical Chemistry
CHEM.description: Coulometry electrolytic separations polargraphy chronopotentimetry coulometric titrations voltammetry and hydrodynamic electrochemical methods of analysis.

CHEM.name: Environmental Analytical Chemistry
CHEM.description: Application of techniques from analytical chemistry in monitoring the environment.

CHEM.name: Analytical Spectroscopy
CHEM.description: Modern analytical spectroscopy and use of analytical techniques in chemistry and chemical engineering.

CHEM.name: Scanned Probe Techniques
CHEM.description: An in-depth analysis of the theory practice and application of scanning probe microscopy techniques.

CHEM.name: Identification of Organic Compounds
CHEM.description: Description of molecular structure and identification of organic compounds using spectroscopic techniques.

CHEM.name: Physical Organic Chemistry
CHEM.description: Physical methods in organic chemistry determination of reaction pathways.

CHEM.name: Organic Synthesis
CHEM.description: Methods and strategy for the preparation of complex organic compounds.

CHEM.name: Advanced Organic Synthesis
CHEM.description: Advanced topics in the synthesis of complex organic molecules.

CHEM.name: Computational Methods in Organic Chemistry and Biochemistry
CHEM.description: The development of approximate methods in molecular orbital theory and molecular mechanics and their application to problems in organic and biochemistry.

CHEM.name: Chemical Thermodynamics and Kinetics
CHEM.description: Laws of classical thermodynamics and their chemical applications.  Introduction to statistical mechanics and chemical kinetics.

CHEM.name: Quantum Chemistry and Molecular Spectroscopy
CHEM.description: Introduction to quantum mechanics and its application to molecular systems atomic and molecular spectroscopy.

CHEM.name: Statistical Mechanics
CHEM.description: Statistical thermodynamics lattice statistics molecular distribution and correlation functions the theories of liquids and solutions phase transitions cluster theory and measurement.

CHEM.name: Chemical Kinetics and Reaction Dynamics
CHEM.description: Modern theoretical and experimental methods for studying macroscopic and microscopic bimolecular and unimolecular processes are discussed as are methods for describing complex kinetic systems.

CHEM.name: Chemistry of Electronic Organic Materials
CHEM.description: This course provides a broad description of the basic chemical and physical concepts that determine the properties of electrically active materials.

CHEM.name: Chemistry of Optical Organic Materials
CHEM.description: Course description includes synthesis electronic structure physico-chemical characterization and device applications of optically active organic materials.

CHEM.name: Computational Chemistry
CHEM.description: Introductory course in computational chemistry discussing electronic structure theory semiemphirical methods molecular mechanics transistion-state searching and computation of thermodynamic quantities.

CHEM.name: Quantum Mechanics
CHEM.description: Important concepts and applications of quantum mechanics at the intermediate level including operators perturbation and variational methods applied to atoms and molecules.

CHEM.name: Molecular Spectroscopy
CHEM.description: Study of energy of electronic transitions in molecules selection rules excitation processes and laser spectroscopy.

CHEM.name: Biochemistry I
CHEM.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins lipids carbohydrates nucleic acids and other biomolecules.

CHEM.name: Biochemistry II
CHEM.description: The chemistry and biochemistry of proteins lipids carbohydrates nucleic acids and other biomolecules.

CHEM.name: Enzymology and Metabolism
CHEM.description: Structure and chemistry of enzymes enzyme mechanism enzyme kinetics enzyme inhibitors and medicinal chemistry.

CHEM.name: Macromolecular Structure
CHEM.description: Principles of protein nucleic acid and membrane structure. Major emphasis on protein folding detailed description of three-dimensional structure of proteins and nucleic acids.

CHEM.name: Molecular Biochemistry
CHEM.description: Current topics in molecular biology including eukaryotic transcriptions RNA processing repair and recombination immunity viruses DNA fingerprinting and genome sequencing.

CHEM.name: Protein Crystallography
CHEM.description: Application of crystallographic principles to the structure determination of macromolecules by molecular replacement multiple isomorphous replacements. High-speed data collection methods and cryocrystallography.

CHEM.name: Biophysical Chemistry
CHEM.description: Applications of the principles and techniques of physical chemistry in biochemistry with emphasis in the equilibrium and dynamic behavior of macromolecules in solution.

CHEM.name: Drug Design and Discovery
CHEM.description: Application of principles of chemistry and biology to the creation of knowledge leading to the introduction of new therapeutic agents.

CHEM.name: Contemporary Biochemistry
CHEM.description: Topics vary from year to year but will include subjects from the biochemical literature such as in Journal of Biological Chemistry.

CHEM.name: Preparation and Reaction of Polymers
CHEM.description: A detailed treatment of the reactions involved in the synthesis of both human-made and natural polymers including preparation and degradative reactions of polymer systems. Crosslisted with CHE and PTFE 6750.

CHEM.name: Physical Chemistry of Polymer Solutions
CHEM.description: Study of polymer solutions polymer miscibility absorptions sorptions plasticization molecular weights molecular weight distributions and interfacial phenomena using thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Crosslisted with CHE MSE and PTFE 6751.

CHEM.name: Polymer Characterization
CHEM.description: This course introduces the student to surface near-surface and structural methods of polymer characterization. Specialized techniques critical to physical structure are emphasized. Crosslisted with CHE MSE and PTFE 6752.

CHEM.name: Theoretical Chemistry of Polymers
CHEM.description: Thermodynamics and microscopic dynamics of polymers. Fundamental concepts including scaling concepts governing anisotropy of polarizability phase transitions morphology time-dependent correlations etc. are discussed. Crosslisted with MSE and PTFE 6755.

CHEM.name: Discovery of Signaling Molecules
CHEM.description: The diversity of chemical signals between organisms and their structural specificities will be presented along with chemical and biological methods for isolating signaling molecules. Crosslisted with BIOL6756 and CEE6756.

CHEM.name: Biocatalysis and Metabolic Engineering
CHEM.description: This course provides in-depth coverage of various topics in biocatalysis and metabolic engineering. Goals of this course are the development of an understanding of proteins as catalysts their functioning in metabolic networks their application in various industries and recognition of their potential for addressing future challenges in science and engineering. Crosslisted with CHBE6760.

CHEM.name: Drug Design, Development and Delivery
CHEM.description: Introduction to the pharmaceutical development process including design of new drugs synthesis and manufacturing issues and methods of delivery into the body. Includes student presentations.  Crosslisted with BMED6765 and CHBE6765.

CHEM.name: Introduction to Research
CHEM.description: Introduction to laboratory techniques experimental design library and database searching presentations.

Humanities credit awarded for CHIN1001 upon successful completion of CHIN1002 or CHIN2001.

CHIN.description: Key aspects of culture and highlights of Chinese civilization philosophy arts and architecture belief systems family relationships historical periods social changes technological innovation. Taught in English.

CHIN.description: Explores the Chinese language from multiple perspectives examining its multifaceted and intriguing interactions with society culture gender music politics and media. Taught in English.

CHIN.description: Chinese films and media serve as authentic texts to enhance students language-learning skills and knowledge in Chinese culture philosophy history and society. Taught in Chinese.

CHIN.name: Chinese Domestic Internship

CHIN.name: Intercultural Seminar
CHIN.description: Integrates cross-cultural research and reflection into discussion of current issues in China. Taught in Chinese.

CHIN.name: Professional Portfolio Development
CHIN.description: Preparation of a professional portfolio connecting experiences and coursework in the MS program towards career preparation. Conducted in Chinese.

CHIN.name: Applied Language Practicum
CHIN.description: Students will serve as researchers student aides and apprentice instructors for any 3/4000-level undergraduate course approved by their adviser and the course.

CHIN.name: Applied Language Practicum Abroad
CHIN.description: Students serve as researchers and apprentice instructors in the LBAT or other faculty-led overseas language immersion program of the School of Modern Languages.

CHIN.name: Chinese Internship Abroad
CHIN.description: Students complete internships abroad in China. Conducted in Chinese. Online course.

CHIN.name: Chinese Internship Abroad
CHIN.description: Students complete internships abroad in a Spanish-speaking country. Conducted in Spanish. Online course. 6 credits.
