HTS.name: Proseminar in Social Theory
HTS.description: An introduction to key theoretical traditions in modern social theory including both classical and contemporary works.

HTS.name: Proseminar in the History of Technology
HTS.description: Identifies major areas of interest in the history of technology and introduces a variety of approaches to the discipline.

HTS.name: Social and Political History of the United States
HTS.description: Examines the social experiences of Americans and the political contexts in which they lived.

HTS.name: Social and Political History of Europe
HTS.description: Classic works and debates in European social history including transition from feudalism to capitalism French Revolution rural history and industrialization and origins of nationalism.

HTS.name: Social and Political History of the Nonwestern World
HTS.description: Covers basic empirical and relevant theoretical literature in English on the social and political history of Africa Asia and/or Latin America.

HTS.name: Business Organizations and Political Economy
HTS.description: Examines the historical evolution and contemporary operations of business institutions within the larger context of political economy emphasis on business government and technology.

HTS.name: Gender, Science, and Technology
HTS.description: Examines the ways in which gendered relations shape scientific and technological institutions careers artifacts knowledge and culture.

HTS.name: Technology and Modern Culture
HTS.description: Introduces the complex interplay between technological systems and diffuse systems of consumption social organization and culture beyond the act of production.

HTS.name: Studies in Science and Engineering
HTS.description: Empirical investigation of scientific and engineering practice in historical and contemporary settings.

HTS.name: Development, Technology and Science
HTS.description: Explores the impact of science and technology on development and modernization.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6113 and HTS4011.

HTS.name: Topics in the History of Science
HTS.description: Explores topics in the history of science in their social and political contexts.

HTS.name: Sociology of Science and Technology
HTS.description: Explores current debates in the history of the sociology of science and technology.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6115 and HTS3082.

HTS.name: The Environment in World History
HTS.description: Surveys the field of global environmental history with examples taken from biology geography sociology and anthropology.

HTS.name: Urbanization
HTS.description: An intensive introduction to the political social and economic forces involved in the process of urbanization.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6117 and HTS 6105.

HTS.name: Sci Tech and the Economy
HTS.description: Examines how science and technology are related to economic institutions and processes.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6118 and HTS 6107.

HTS.name: Race and Ethnicity
HTS.description: Examines the structural impact of racism and ethnic discrimination on American society and the controversies over racial and ethnic identity. Credit not allowed for both HTS6119 and HTS 6108.

HTS.name: Inequality, Science and Technology
HTS.description: Explores the impacts of science and technology on inequality as well as how notions of difference have shaped science and technology.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6120 and HTS 6109.

HTS.name: Science, Technology and Security
HTS.description: Topics in the study of the relationship between national security and the scientific-technological enterprise from diverse perspectives.

HTS.name: History of Medicine
HTS.description: The impact of disease in history modern developments in medicine and health focusing on western medicine in a global context.

HTS.name: Social and Cultural Studies of Biomedicine
HTS.description: Introduces students to the changing social political and corporate worlds of the biological sciences biotechnology and biomedicine.

HTS.name: Science and Technology Beyond Borders
HTS.description: Discusses the roles of science and technology as instruments of social control and of social change in development and modernization.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6124 and HTS 6104.

HTS.name: Science, Technology & Soceity: Core Seminar
HTS.description: This survey course covers key works in Science Technology  Society and guest lectures introduce students to faculty doing STS-related research across the Ivan Allen College.  Credit not allowed for both HTS6743 and PUBP6743 or LCC 6743.

HTS.name: Research Paper
HTS.description: Under the direct supervision of one or more faculty members graduate students will complete an original research design and execute that study.

HTS.name: Foundations of Socio-historical Analysis
HTS.description: Introduces key concepts and methods used in the historical analysis of social phenomena.

HTS.name: Research and Writing Seminar
HTS.description: Introduces methods of sociohistorical research and writing requires preparation of an original research paper based on primary sources.

HTS.name: Comprehensive Exam Preparation
HTS.description: Preparation for comprehensive exam in fields of history or sociology.

HTS.name: Comparative History of Labor, Industry, Technology, and Society
HTS.description: An intensive team-taught reading seminar covering major themes and classic works in these fields.

HTS.name: Teaching Assistantship
HTS.description: For graduate students holding a teaching assistantship.

HTS.name: Research Assistantship
HTS.description: For graduate students holding a research assistantship.

ID.name: Industrial Design Fundamentals 1
ID.description: Theory and practice in Industrial Design including an introduction to process methodology ergonomics research tools and user research.  Focus is on fundamental design principles.

ID.name: Industrial Design Fundamentals 2
ID.description: Theory and practice in Industrial Design including an introduction to process methodology ergonomics research tools and user research.  Focus is on CAD and digital prototyping.

ID.name: Introduction to Industrial Design 1
ID.description: Introduction to Industrial Design  a survey of evolving diverse career options and the designers impact on society. Emphasis on traditional product design research and strategy.

ID.name: Introduction to Industrial Design 2
ID.description: Introduction to Industrial Design  a survey of evolving diverse career options and the designers impact on society. Emphasis is on user experience and interaction design.

ID.name: Introduction to Graphic Communications 1
ID.description: Introduction to graphic design composition layout color typography photography social media  videography. Emphasis of this first course is on development of basic visual literacies.

ID.name: Introduction to Graphic Communications 2
ID.description: Introduction to graphic design composition layout color typography photography social media  videography. This second course in the sequence will emphasize digital skill development.

ID.name: Introduction to Sketching and Modeling 1
ID.description: Introduction to basic visual representation techniques that empower designers of products services and systems through sketching model making computer-assisted drawing rapid prototyping and other methods.

ID.name: Introduction to Sketching and Modeling 2
ID.description: Introduction to intermediate visual representation techniques that empower designers of products services and systems through sketching model making computer-assisted drawing rapid prototyping and other methods.

ID.name: Introductory Design I
ID.description: Foundation course in visual communications theory and practice continuing the development of two-dimensional visual literacy. Emphasis on both analog and digital media.

ID.name: Introductory Design II
ID.description: Foundation course in form giving and representing continuing the development of three-dimensional visual literacy.  Emphasis on visual relationships between form and image.

ID.name: Industrial Design Studio 1
ID.description: This course provides an introduction to the design process on visual principles and presentation techniques with a focus on sketching and modeling techniques related to 3D form.

ID.name: Industrial Design Studio 2
ID.description: This course applies more structured design methods to research and exploration of product form and function and introduces concepts of universal design and user centered design.

ID.name: Industrial Design Studio 1
ID.description: This course applied structured design methods to research and exploration of product form and function and introduces concepts of user centered design.

ID.name: Industrial Design Studio 2
ID.description: This course applies more structured design methods to research and exploration of product form and function and introduces concepts of universal design.

ID.name: Digital Design Methods
ID.description: This course introduces the basics of product design in the CAD environment. Stuents design a product apply 3D scanning produce an animation and 3D print.

ID.name: 3D Modeling
ID.description: This course introduces 3D modeling methods for solid and surface modeling in CAD software. Students create multi-component assembly drawings and explore product rendering techniques.

ID.name: Sustainable Issues for Design
ID.description: Introduction to the broad environmental issues that face humankind as a participant in the biosphere.

ID.name: History of Modern Industrial Design
ID.description: History and development of industrial design from the beginning of the Industrial Revolution to the present.

ID.name: History of Art 1
ID.description: This course surveys art from Prehistory through the Renaissance and is organized around stylistic periods that are arranged chronologically. Classes will consist of lectures with slides that focus on these stylistic periods.

ID.name: History of Art 2
ID.description: This course surveys the major artistic movements and aesthetics of the 17th 18th 19th 20th and early 21st centuries in painting sculpture and architecture.

ID.name: Human Factors in Design
ID.description: This course examines the theory of Human Factors to provide a working knowledge of the physical and cognitive attributes of people that designers must accomodate.

ID.name: User Centered Design Methods
ID.description: This course introduces students to user-centric design methods used to identify understand assess and prioritize the factors that contribute to more effective design solutions.

ID.name: Visual Design Thinking
ID.description: Introduction to techniques to help designers build a vocabulary to support effective visual communication including fundamentals of layout sketching rendering schematics information graphics  storyboarding.

ID.name: Introduction to Smart Product Design
ID.description: This course provides an introduction to smart product design including the basics of sensor technologies electronics and programming required to produce working product concept prototypes.

ID.name: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
ID.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID.name: Undergraduate Research
ID.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID.name: Intermediate Design I
ID.description: The systematic design process as applied to industrial design and packaging problems.

ID.name: Intermediate Design II
ID.description: Various dimensions of human factors applied to design including aging disability normal age change childhood and adult anthropometrics and human capability.

ID.name: Health Design Studio 1
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of new and/or improved health-related products with an emphasis on inclusive design.

ID.name: Health Design Studio 2
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of new and/or improved health-related products with an emphasis on products and product systems.

ID.name: Product Development Studio 1
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the use of parametric design and CNC capabilities in the design development of products services  systems.

ID.name: Product Development Studio 2
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of real-world products services  systems in collaboration with external sponsors.

ID.name: Interactive Product Design Studio 1
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on new applications of sensor-based technologies with an emphasis on the importance of user-centered design.

ID.name: Interactive Product Design Studio 2
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on new applications of sensor-based technologies with an emphasis on interactive environments navigation and mobility.

ID.name: Industrial Design Computing I
ID.description: Introduction to 2-D computer drawing systems.

ID.name: Industrial Design Computing II
ID.description: Introduction to 3-D modeling systems.

ID.name: Design & Community: The Social and Environmental Impact of Design
ID.description: Students explore socially and environmentally responsible industrial design practices at home and abroad and partner with local organizations to develop community-based design projects.

ID.name: Materials I: Renewables
ID.description: This course examines the characteristics production technologies histories and environmental impacts of nine categories of renewable materials familiar to industrial design.

ID.name: Materials and Processes II: Nonrenewables
ID.description: Examination of characteristics production technologies histories and environmental impacts of nonrenewable materials used in industrial design.

ID.name: Design Methods: User Centered Design
ID.description: This course introduces students to current user-centric design methods used to identify understand assess and prioritize the factors that contribute to more effective design solutions.

ID.name: Introduction to Interactive Product Design
ID.description: This course provides an introduction to interactive product design including the basics of sensor technologies electronics and programming required to produce working product concept prototypes.

ID.name: Tangible Interaction
ID.description: This course addresses the design process related to interactive environments.  Projects will emphasize the inclusion of ubiquitous and emerging interactive technologies.

ID.name: Special Topics
ID.description: Topics of current interest in industrial design.

ID.name: Special Topics
ID.description: Topics of current interest in Industrial Design.

ID.name: Special Topics
ID.description: Special Topics in Industrial Design (lecture and lab).

ID.name: Advanced Design I
ID.description: Application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary design problems. Experience in solving real design problems from areas such as consumer products and equipment transportation and equipment.

ID.name: Advanced Design II
ID.description: Capstone industrial design project of students own choosing with consent of instructor to refine problem-solving and design ability in preparation for professional practice.

ID.name: ID Capstone Design Studio 1
ID.description: Comprehensive team-based projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products  systems with emphasis on integration of research design prototyping and testing.

ID.name: ID Capstone Design Studio 2
ID.description: Comprehensive individual projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products  systems with emphasis on integration of research design prototyping and testing.

ID.name: Invention Studio 1
ID.description: Comprehensive projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products systems  services with emphasis on invention design and manufacturing.

ID.name: Invention Studio 2
ID.description: Comprehensive projects incorporating an iterative approach to design development of products systems  services with emphasis on invention innovation and entrepreneurship.

ID.name: ID/ME Collaborative Design Studio 1
ID.description: An interdisciplinary team-based approach to integrate industrial design and engineering competencies in design development of products and systems with emphasis on corporate-sponsored projects.

ID.name: ID/ME Collaborative Design Studio 2
ID.description: An interdisciplinary team-based approach to integrate industrial design and engineering competencies in design development of products and systems with emphasis on humanitarian projects.

ID.name: Alias Studio I
ID.description: Introduction to modeling rendering and animation with Alias Studio software.

ID.name: Alias Studio II
ID.description: Introduction to product animation using Alias Studio software.

ID.name: Advanced Modeling Concepts for Creating Complex Forms
ID.description: The Advance Modeling Concepts Course explores concepts tools and theories used to model and validate complex forms encountered in the product design process.

ID.name: Parametric Product Modeling
ID.description: This course focuses on advanced digital methods in product modeling for visual analysis flexible design approaches and digital fabrication methods.

ID.name: Design/Research Methods
ID.description: Research methods applicable to industrial design including task definition information gathering and analysis.

ID.name: Professional Practice and Preparation
ID.description: Principles of consulting and corporate industrial design including preparation of the professional portfolio.

ID.name: French Society and Culture
ID.description: Studies in French society and culture.

ID.name: Theorizing Design
ID.description: Introduction to what designers do and how they undertake their tasks examples will come from a variety of design disciplines.

ID.name: French Design and Culture
ID.description: Studies in French design and culture.

ID.name: Culture of Objects:  A Seminar on the Design and Culture of Objects
ID.description: This seminar surveys the theories and methodologies within the field of industrial design that locate meaning in the designed object as derived from culture.

ID.name: Introduction to Universal Design in the Built Environment
ID.description: This course provides an introduction to universal design focusing on the implications of ability on the usability of places products and systems for all individuals.

ID.name: Prototyping Interaction: Designing for Experience
ID.description: This course exposes students to a range of practical methods for research and design exploration to support the design development of interactive products and technologies.

ID.name: Design Sketching
ID.description: This course addresses drawing and visualization techniques necessary for design thinking and development and introduces methods and processes to formulate and present visual information.

ID.name: Developing a Professional Design Portfolio
ID.description: The portfolio development course provides students with a structured approach to preparing a professional visual record of their work in print and digital formats.

ID.name: Wearable Product Design
ID.description: Wearable Product Design explores techniques in producing designs and prototypes for on-body interactions and general textile knowledge for making effective wearable products.

ID.name: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
ID.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID.name: Undergraduate Research
ID.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ID.name: Special Topics: Furniture
ID.description: Special topics in furniture design not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Special Topics: Sustainability
ID.description: Special topics in sustainability not included in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Special Topics: Information Technology
ID.description: Special topics in information technology not included in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Special Topics: Collaborative
ID.description: Application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary problems by a team. Projects from a range of interest areas  consumer industrial products transportation furniture.

ID.name: Special Topics: History and Theory
ID.description: Special topics in history and theory not included in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Special Problems: Visual Communications
ID.description: Special problems in communication not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Special Problems: Mentor Program
ID.description: Special problems in teaching pedagogy mentoring by senior faculty in basic and intermediate design courses.

ID.name: Special Problems: Mentor Program
ID.description: Special problems in teaching pedagogy mentoring by senior faculty in basic and intermediate design courses.

ID.name: Special Problems: Research
ID.description: Special research topics for advanced students not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Special Problems: Research
ID.description: Special research topics for advanced students not covered in the professional curriculum.

ID.name: Introduction to Graduate Studies in Industrial Design
ID.description: Introduction to the theory and practice of graduate studies in Industrial Design in relation to behavior research and consumer products.

ID.name: Human Centered Design
ID.description: This course examines design artifacts in relation to the human body aging disabilities and environments.

ID.name: Graduate Studio A
ID.description: Studio introduces the MID certificate in Design. The ID studio class stands at the heart of design education and professional practice. Industrial Design is considered from a strategic perspective. Assignments explore the business technology and use experience components.

ID.name: Graduate Studio B
ID.description: This course is a project-based ID studio that gives students an overview of and practice with the insights-driven iterative ID process.

ID.name: Drawing
ID.description: This course trains students in the basics of sketching and free hand drawing needed in the Industrial Design studio environment.

ID.name: Brand and Visual Design
ID.description: This course introduces the principles of branding and visual identity. It emphasizes branded experiences in a service/product/mobile context.

ID.name: 3D Design Methods
ID.description: 3D Design Methods teaches students body scanning free form CAD software and 3D printing through an iterative design process.

ID.name: Integrated Product Design
ID.description: Introduction to smart products teaches students to create IOT products. Students work with sensors and signals U/I design and multi-platform prototyping.

ID.name: Survey of Industrial Design History
ID.description: This course surveys the history of industrial design from the Industrial Revolution to contemporary times.

ID.name: Human Factors and Ergonomics
ID.description: This course will cover an introduction to the topics of Human Factors and Ergonomics and their practical application in the design of workplace products consumer products and services.

ID.name: Industrial Design Graduate Studio I
ID.description: Graduate application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary design problems. Experience in solving real design problems for consumer products.

ID.name: Industrial Design Graduate Studio II
ID.description: Graduate-level application of the design process to advanced multidisciplinary problems.

ID.name: Graduate Studio One
ID.description: Studio introduces MID program philosophy. Industrial Design is considered from a strategic perspective. Assignments explore the business technology and user experience components.

ID.name: Grad Studio Two: Health and Wellness
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design of new and/or improved health products services and interactions.

ID.name: Grad Studio Two: Interactive Products
ID.description: The application of systematic design methods to projects focused on the design development of new and/or improved interactive or smart products.

ID.name: Strategic Design Language
ID.description: Introduction to techniques to help designers clarify and support design ideas in a strategic business context by exploring methods to better leverage visual design skills.

ID.name: Service Design
ID.description: This course introduces best practices of service design and focuses on the alignment and design of multiple brand touch points to optimize customer experience.

ID.name: Service Design, Brand and Value Creation
ID.description: This course introduces students to how visual design product design and service design align to optimize user experiences that drive business.

ID.name: Healthcare Design of the Future
ID.description: Introduction to research-based approaches to integrated healthcare design innovation.

ID.name: Master's Project
ID.description: Student produces a product prototype that must meet  with instructors  approval.

ID.name: Visualizing Interaction
ID.description: Introduction to techniques that empower designers to plan and create effective and clear visual communication depicting the interaction and relationships between people products and services.

ID.name: Advanced Sketching
ID.description: This class will focus on developing advanced traditional (non-digital) sketching rendering and presentation techniques.

ID.name: Computation, Creativity and Design Cognition
ID.description: This course investigates computational methods models tools that support design creativity and cognition.  Credit not allowed for both ID6509 and ARCH6509.

ID.name: Design for Interaction: Working with New Technologies
ID.description: This course examines opportunities for designers to leverage visualization and prototyping methods to foster new applications of technology to enhance user experience in everyday life.

ID.name: Interface Prototyping: Exploring Tools & Theories
ID.description: This course focuses on the development of interactive prototypes for digital displays. Students learn how graphic and interactive design principles can be represented through prototypes.

ID.name: Human-Computer Interaction Professional Preparation and Practice
ID.description: Preparation for a professional career in HCI. Hands-on workshops in resume and portfolio building interviewing public speaking team work. HCI career choices and trajectories.

ID.name: Design of Interactive Environments
ID.description: Investigate and design ambient intelligent interactive interfaces and computational applications in tangible and physical environment to support health wellness and quality of life.  Credit not allowed for both ID6763 and COA6763 or CS6763.

ID.name: Investigations of Universal Design in the Built Environment
ID.description: This course provides an advanced level to universal design focusing on the implications of ability on the usability of places products and systems for all individuals.

ID.name: Web Design, Usability and Accessibility
ID.description: This course will teach students the fundamentals of web design and usability issues in online environments with an emphasis on universal design principles and accessibility.

ID.name: HCI Master's Project
ID.description: Final project for students completing a Human-Computer Interaction masters degree in the Digitial Media track. Repeatable for multi-semester projects.

ID.name: Master's Thesis
ID.description: Provides students with the opportunity to pursue advanced research under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE.name: Probability with Applications
ISYE.description: Topics include conditional probability density and distribution functions from engineering expectation conditional expectation laws of large numbers central limit theorem and introduction to Poisson Processes.

ISYE.name: Basic Statistical Methods
ISYE.description: Point and interval estimation of systems parameters statistical decision making about differences in system parameters analysis and modeling of relationships between variables.

ISYE.name: Honors Probability
ISYE.description: Topics parallel those in ISYE2027 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not allowed for both ISYE2127 and 2027.

ISYE.name: Honors Statistics
ISYE.description: Topics parallel to those in ISYE2028 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not given for both ISYE2028 and 2128.

ISYE.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE.name: Essentials of Engineering Economy
ISYE.description: Introduction to engineering economic decision making economic decision criteria discounted cash flow replacement and timing decisions risk depreciation and income tax.

ISYE.name: Basic Statistical Methods
ISYE.description: Point and interval estimation of systems parameters statistical decision making about differences in system parameters analysis and modeling of relationships between variables.

ISYE.name: Methods of Quality Improvement
ISYE.description: Topics include quality system requirements designed experiments process capability analysis measurement capability statistical process control and acceptance sampling plans. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE3039 and ISYE6382.

ISYE.name: Simulation Analysis and Design
ISYE.description: Discrete event simulation methodology emphasizing the statistical basis for simulation modeling and analysis. Overview of computer languages and simulation design applied to various industrial situations.

ISYE.name: Introduction to Supply Chain Modeling: Logistics
ISYE.description: Course focuses on engineering design concepts and optimization models for logistics decision making in three modules supply chain design planning and execution and transportation.

ISYE.name: Introduction to Supply Chain Modeling: Manufacturing and Warehousing
ISYE.description: Design and operation of manufacturing and warehousing facilities.

ISYE.name: Cornerstone Design for Industrial Engineers
ISYE.description: Structure a complex problem through information gathering data analysis industrial engineering and design principles application project management while working in and leading diverse teams.

ISYE.name: Engineering Optimization
ISYE.description: Topics include modeling with networks and graphs linear nonlinear and integer programming construction of models employing modern modeling languages and general solution strategies.

ISYE.name: Probabilistic Operations Research
ISYE.description: Methods for describing stochastic movements of material in manufacturing facilities supply chain and equipment maintenance networks. Includes analysis of congestion delays and inventory ordering policies.

ISYE.name: Statistics and Applications
ISYE.description: Introduction to probability probability distributions point estimation confidence intervals hypothesis testing linear regression and analysis of variance. Crosslisted with MATH 3770 and CEE3770. Also credit not awarded for both ISYE3770 and MATH3670.

ISYE.name: Introduction to Cognitive Science
ISYE.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on cognitive science. Interdisciplinary approaches to issues in cognition including memory language problem solving learning perception and action. Crosslisted with CS PST and PSYC3790.

ISYE.name: Special Topics
ISYE.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE.name: Special Topics
ISYE.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE.name: Design of Human-Integrated Systems
ISYE.description: Topics include general cognitive systems engineering concepts and principles and specific concepts and principles of interface design task analysis prototyping and empirical usability of evaluation methods.

ISYE.name: Regression and Forecasting
ISYE.description: Regression analysis multiple linear regression diagnostics and variable selection.  Forecasting exponential smoothing techniques and autoregressive moving average models.

ISYE.name: Decision and Data Analytics
ISYE.description: This course integrates decision and data analytics to solve real-world business problems.  It includes hands-on system modeling data collection and analysis and reporting writing projects.

ISYE.name: Advanced Simulation
ISYE.description: Advanced modeling and statistical concepts in discrete-event simulations Monte Carlo simulation estimation of error and risk advanced input modeling techniques comparison and optimization of systems.

ISYE.name: Senior Design
ISYE.description: Senior design project requiring student to formulate a project plan with an off-campus enterprise. Includes specific milestones targets and evaluation criteria.

ISYE.name: Advanced Supply Chain Logistics
ISYE.description: This course is a follow-up to ISyE 3103 that covers optimization models and case studies for logistics network design and logistics operations.

ISYE.name: Advanced Optimization
ISYE.description: Theory and implementation of practical methods to find good or optimal solutions to optimization problems too large or complex to solve in a straightforward way.

ISYE.name: Constraint Programming
ISYE.description: This course is an introduction to constraint programming from its modeling language to its computational methodology and its applications to scheduling routing and resource allocation.

ISYE.name: Advanced Stochastic Systems
ISYE.description: The course will cover Jackson Networks and Markov Decision Processes with applications to production/inventory systems customer contact centers revenue management and health care.

ISYE.name: Supply Chain Economics
ISYE.description: The course studies techniques for coordination and collaboration in supply chains.  Applications include pricing strategies revenue management gaming and incentives.

ISYE.name: Capital Investment Analysis
ISYE.description: Students learn core concepts and techniques for economic decision and analysis of complex capital investment problems that involve dimensions of time uncertainty and strategy.

ISYE.name: Honors Optimization
ISYE.description: Topics parallel those in ISYE 4231 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not given for both ISYE4331 and 4231.

ISYE.name: Energy, Efficiency, and Sustainability
ISYE.description: Analysis and modeling of energy production and use material and energy efficiency sustainability and cost for systems products and services.

ISYE.name: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
ISYE.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE.name: Undergraduate Research
ISYE.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

ISYE.name: Bio-Inspired Design
ISYE.description: We examine evolutionary adaptation as a course for engineering design inspiration utilizing principles of scaling adaptability and robust multifunctionality that characterize biological systems.  Credit not allowed for both ISYE4740 and (BIOL4740 or PTFE 4740 or MSE4740 or ME4740).
ISYE Senior Design Preparation.

ISYE.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE.name: Honors Topics
ISYE.description: Topics of current interest in the field of ISYE that are covered with an appropriately high level of innovation and rigor.

ISYE.name: Special Topics
ISYE.description: Topics of current interest in the field of ISYE.

ISYE.name: Special Topics
ISYE.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

ISYE.name: Special Problems
ISYE.description: A variable hour credit opportunity to develop initiative and apply fundamental principles by performing semioriginal laboratory or research work in ISYE.

ISYE.name: Special Problems
ISYE.description: A variable credit hour opportunity to develop initiative and apply fundamental principles by performing semioriginal laboratory or research work in ISYE.

ISYE.name: Special Problems
ISYE.description: A variable credit hour opportunity to develop initiative and apply fundamental principles by performing semioriginal laboratory or research work in ISYE.

ISYE.name: Organizational Behavior for Engineers
ISYE.description: Studies the scientific generation formalization and application of the knowledge of individual and group behaviors that engineers need to function effectively within contexts.

ISYE.name: Manufacturing Systems
ISYE.description: Topics include analysis of flows bottlenecks and queuing types of operations manufacturing inventories aggregreate production planning lot sizes and lead times and pull production systems.

ISYE.name: Warehousing Systems
ISYE.description: Topics include design and analysis of materials handling systems warehouse layout order picking strategies warehousing inventories warehouse management systems integration of production and distribution systems. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE6202 and ISYE6383.

ISYE.name: Transportation and Supply Chain Systems
ISYE.description: Topics include supply chain characterization site location mode selection distribution planning vehicle routing demand management replenishment management geographic information systems and real-time control issues. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE6203 and ISYE6383.

ISYE.name: Cognitive Engineering
ISYE.description: Application of cognitive science concepts to system design and the development of concepts appropriate for understanding and aiding cognition in naturally or technologically complex environments.

ISYE.name: Models in Human-Machine Systems
ISYE.description: The development and use of mathematical models of human behavior are considered.  Approaches from estimation theory control theory queuing theory and fuzzy set theory are considered.

ISYE.name: Understanding and Aiding Human Decision Making
ISYE.description: Prescriptive and descriptive theories of human decision making are discussed/contrasted.  Approaches to aiding human decision making are considered in context of these theoretical frameworks.

ISYE.name: Advances in Human-Machine Systems Research
ISYE.description: State-of-the-art research directions including supervisory control models of human command control tasks human-computer interface in scheduling and supervision of flexible manufacturing systems.

ISYE.name: Advanced Engineering Economy
ISYE.description: Advanced engineering economy topics including economic worth economic optimization under constraints risk and uncertainty foundations of utility theory.

ISYE.name: Introduction to Financial Engineering
ISYE.description: Advanced techniques for economic analysis of capital investment. Basic terminology and financial engineering concepts for managing and valuing project risk. Real options applications in systems engineering.

ISYE.name: Productive Measurement and Analysis
ISYE.description: Modern measurement of productivity measurement and analysis including principles issues and latest techniques associated with benchmarking efficiency measurement and productivity tracking.  Empirical studies and group projects.

ISYE.name: Economic Decision Analysis
ISYE.description: Topics include preferences and utilities social choice equilibrium concepts noncooperative and cooperative game theory price mechanisms auction mechanisms voting theory and incentive compatibility.

ISYE.name: Design of Human-integrated Systems
ISYE.description: Analysis and design of complex work domains in technological environments.  Credit not allowed for both ISYE6231 and AE6721.

ISYE.name: Safety-critical Real-time Systems
ISYE.description: Study of system safety human error and software reliability.

ISYE.name: Measurement and Evaluation of Human-integrated Systems
ISYE.description: Measurements of complex systems including workload operator strategy and performance.

ISYE.name: Scheduling Theory
ISYE.description: Includes topics in sequencing and scheduling with emphasis on deterministic machine scheduling problems with some stochastic results examined.  Complexity of various problems will be analyzed.

ISYE.name: Public Impact Applications of Operations Research and Management Science
ISYE.description: The focus is on the health and public applications of Operations Research.  Students will complete a group project with a non-profit organization and discuss papers.

ISYE.name: Statistics for Supply Chain Engineering
ISYE.description: Collection management and analysis of supply chain data.

ISYE.name: Finance for Supply Chain Engineering
ISYE.description: Investment and analysis of operating capital.

ISYE.name: Operations Research for Supply Chain Engineering I
ISYE.description: Deterministic models of supply chains including location and material flow.  Optimization techniques including linear programming network flows integer programming and heuristics.

ISYE.name: Operations Research fo Supply Chain Engineering II
ISYE.description: Probabilistic models of supply chains including the effects of variability models of wholesale and retail demand forecasting and simulation.

ISYE.name: Supply Chain Engineering I
ISYE.description: Production scheduling inventory systems warehousing including stocking strategies order-picking sortation automation distribution.

ISYE.name: Supply Chain Engineering II
ISYE.description: Transportation truck-load and less-than-truckload and package-courier systems container shipping including port operations steamship scheduling railroad operations including intermodal air cargo.  The international freight network and patterns of freight flow.  Management and recirculation of trailers/containers.  Labor issues.

ISYE.name: Supply Chain Engineering III
ISYE.description: Problems of coordination and collaboration along the supply chain make-or-buy decisions pricing and auctions wholesale and retail channels supply chain dynamics including the bullwhip effect.  Distinctive supply chain issues in key economies.

ISYE.name: Suppply Chain Strategy
ISYE.description: Case studies of notable supply chains successes and failures.

ISYE.name: Supply Chain Information Systems
ISYE.description: Planning and executing systems for inventory warehousing transportation import/export etc.  Services-oriented architecture cloud computing systems integration RFID and other technologies for scanning and monitoring.

ISYE.name: Supply Chain Engineering Seminar
ISYE.description: Through a program of industry speakers and facility tours student will learn to assess and critique supply chain practice.

ISYE.name: Capstone Project for Supply Chain Engineering I
ISYE.description: Small groups of students undertake an industry-sponsored project under faculty guidance.

ISYE.name: Capstone Project for Supply Chain Engineering II
ISYE.description: Small groups of students undertake an industry-sponsored project under faculty guidance.

ISYE.name: Production Planning and Control
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of Production Planning and Lean Manufacturing.

ISYE.name: Manufacturing Reliability
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of Reliability and Maintainability Engineering.

ISYE.name: Quality Control and Six Sigma
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of Quality Control and Six Sigma Methods. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE6382 and ISYE3039.

ISYE.name: Fundamentals of Manufacturing Supply Chain Operations
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of Manufacturing Supply Chain Operations. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE6383 and ISYE6202 or ISYE6383 and ISYE6203.

ISYE.name: Applied Regression Analysis I
ISYE.description: Fundamental coverage of topics in multiple regression and factorial experiments.

ISYE.name: Time Series Analysis
ISYE.description: Basic forecasting methods ARIMA models transfer functions.

ISYE.name: Nonparametric Data Analysis
ISYE.description: Nonparametric statistics and basic categorical data analysis.

ISYE.name: Statistical Methods for Manufacturing Design and Improvement
ISYE.description: Fractional factorial designs response surface methods.

ISYE.name: Fundamentals of Statistics with Applications
ISYE.description: Relationships of statistical estimation and linear models with regression planning and analysis of experiments and the analysis of correlated data.  More mathematical than ISYE6401.

ISYE.name: Theoretical Statistics
ISYE.description: Rigorous introduction to theory of statistical inference. Estimation and testing. Construction and assessment of estimators and tests. Fundamentals of decision theory minimax and Bayes Paradigms.

ISYE.name: Design and Analysis of Experiments
ISYE.description: Analysis of variance full and fractional factoral designs at two and three levels orthogonal arrays response surface methodology robust parameter design for production/process improvement.

ISYE.name: Statistical Modeling and Regression Analysis
ISYE.description: Simple and multiple linear regression inferences and diagnostics stepwise regression and model selection advanced regression methods basic design and analysis of experiments factorial analysis.

ISYE.name: Computational Statistics
ISYE.description: This class describes the available knowledge regarding statistical computing. Topics include random deviates generation importance sampling Monte Carlo Markov chain (MCMC) EM algorithms bootstrapping model selection criteria (e.g. C-p AIC etc.) splines wavelets and Fourier transform.

ISYE.name: Introduction to Theory and Practice of Bayesian Statistics
ISYE.description: Rigorous introduction to the theory of Beysian Statistical Inference. Bayesian estimation and testing. Conjugate priors. Noninformative priors. Bayesian computation. Bayesian networks and Bayesian signal processing. Various engineering applications.

ISYE.name: Biostatistics
ISYE.description: An introduction to fundamental ideas and techniques in Biostatistics with an emphasis on conceptual understanding and on the analysis of real data sets.

ISYE.name: Intro Analytics Modeling
ISYE.description: An introduction to important and commonly-used models in analytics as well as aspects of the modeling process.

ISYE.name: Simulation
ISYE.description: Covers modeling of discrete-event dynamic systems and introduces methods for using these models to solve engineering design and analysis problems.

ISYE.name: Monte Carlo Methods
ISYE.description: Covers state-of-the-art Monte Carlo simulation techniques. These techniques will be used to model and solve a variety of real-world problems from several diverse areas in science and engineering including supply chain analysis and design pattern recognition VLSI design network reliability financial engineering and molecular biology.

ISYE.name: Probabilistic Models and Their Applications
ISYE.description: An introduction to basic stochastic processes such as Poisson and Markov processes and their applications in areas such as inventory reliability and queueing.

ISYE.name: Queuing Theory
ISYE.description: Processing networks with queuing.  Performance analysis using Markov process description of system behavior. Applications and numerical studies in manufacturing system maintainability computer systems telecommunication networks.

ISYE.name: Optimization I: Linear Programming
ISYE.description: Theory algorithms and applications of linear programming.  Topics include the simplex method and resolution of degeneracy duality and sensitivity analysis basis factorization the dual and revised simplex methods and geometry of polyhedra. Intended for Ph.D. students.

ISYE.name: Optimization II: Network Flows and Discrete Optimization
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of integer and combinatorial optimization. Topics include polyhedra cuts Lagrangean duality complexity and others.  This course is intended for Ph.D. students.

ISYE.name: Optimization III: Nonlinear Programming
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of nonlinear optimization.  Topics include optimality conditions convex programming and duality unconstrained and constrained methods. Polynomial algorithms and interior point methods. Dual methods. This course is for students seriously considering a PhD.

ISYE.name: Stochastic Optimization
ISYE.description: An introduction to sequential decision making under uncertainty.  Much of the course is devoted to the theoretical modeling and computational aspects of Markov decision processes.

ISYE.name: Deterministic Optimization
ISYE.description: An introduction to deterministic optimization methodologies including approaches from linear discrete and nonlinear optimization including algorithms and computations. Applications will be introduced as appropriate.

ISYE.name: Financial Optimization Models
ISYE.description: An introduction to optimization techniques with special emphasis on applications to finance including portfolio optimization immunization and risk management.

ISYE.name: Computational Methods in Optimization
ISYE.description: Strategies and techniques for converting optimization theory into effective computational procedures.  Emphasis is on applications in linear integer and nonlinear programming networks and graphs.

ISYE.name: Energy Technology and Policy
ISYE.description: Examines energy production use and production use and policy using quantitative engineering and policy analysis. Addresses resource constraints physical principles and policy analysis methods.

ISYE.name: Basic Statistical Methods
ISYE.description: Overview of basic tools used in statistical analysis and modeling.  Credit not allowed to students seeking a degree in ISYE.

ISYE.name: Computational Data Analysis: Learning, Mining, and Computation
ISYE.description: Theoretical/computational foundations of analyzing large/complex modern datasets including the fundamental concepts of machine learning and data mining needed for both resesarch and practice. Crosslisted with CSE6740. Credit not awarded for both ISYE6740 and CS4641/7641/CSE6740.

ISYE.name: Applied Analytics Practicum
ISYE.description: Practical analytics project experience applying ideas from the classroom to a significant project of interest to a business government agency or other organization.

ISYE.name: Stochastic Processes in Finance
ISYE.description: Mathematical modeling of financial markets derivative securities pricing and portfolio optimization.  Concepts from probability and mathematics are introduced as needed. Crosslisted with MATH6759.

ISYE.name: Stochastic Processes I
ISYE.description: Discrete time Markov chains Poisson and renewal processes transient and limiting behavior average cost and utility measures of systems. Intended for Ph.D students. Crosslisted with MATH6761.

ISYE.name: Stochastic Processes II
ISYE.description: Continuous time Markov chains uniformization transient and limiting behavior Brownian motion and martingales optional sampling and convergence.  Intended for Ph.D. students. Crosslisted with MATH6762.

ISYE.name: Design and Implementation of Systems to Support
ISYE.description: Introduction to large-scale system design to support computational finance for options stocks or other financial instruments. Some programming experience and previous exposure to stocks bonds and options required.  Crosslisted with MATH6767.

ISYE.name: Fixed Income Securities
ISYE.description: Description institutional features and mathematical modeling of fixed income securities.  Use of both deterministic and stochastic models. Crosslisted with MATH6769.

ISYE.name: Management of Technology II
ISYE.description: This course explores the competitive advantage manufacturing and service firms derive from the effective management of their technology workforce materials and information resources. Crosslisted with MGT6772.

ISYE.name: Management of Technology III
ISYE.description: This course provides a forum for the in-depth examination of issues involving the strategic management of high-tech corporate start-ups and small technology-based businesses. Crosslisted with MGT 6773.

ISYE.name: Management of Technology Project
ISYE.description: This course organizes students into multidisciplinary teams devoted to solving a real problem for a technology-based firm.  Crosslisted with MGT 6774.

ISYE.name: Management of Technology Seminar
ISYE.description: This course introduces the frontiers of key technologies provides a forum for visiting speakers from the corporate world and supplements topics from other MOT courses. Crosslisted with MGT 6775.

ISYE.name: Analysis of Emerging Technologies
ISYE.description: Methods for technology monitoring forecasting and assessment. Crosslisted with PUBP6777.

ISYE.name: Dynamic System Simulation and Modeling
ISYE.description: Models of dynamic systems such as aircraftground vehicles and machinery and manual control. Numerical simulation techniques and applications. Interactive simulators. Student programming project. Crosslisted with AE6779.

ISYE.name: Reliability Theory
ISYE.description: Structural properties and reliability of coherent systems.

ISYE.name: Statistical Techniques of Financial Data Analysis
ISYE.description: Fundamentals of statistical inference for models used in the modern analysis of financial data. Crosslisted with MATH6783.

ISYE.name: The Practice of Quantitative and Computational Finance
ISYE.description: Case studies visiting lecturers from financial institutions student group projects of an advanced nature and student reports all centered around quantitative and computational finance. Crosslisted with MATH and MGT6785.

ISYE.name: Computer Integrated Manufacturing Systems Seminar
ISYE.description: Guest speakers on a broad range of manufacturing-related topics  research applications and technology. Required for Certificate in Manufacturing.  Crosslisted with ECE and ME6792.

ISYE.name: Advanced Topics in Quantitative and Computational Finance
ISYE.description: Advanced foundational material and analysis techniques in quantitative and computational finance. Crosslisted with MATH6793.

ISYE.name: Introduction to Cognitive Science
ISYE.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on cognitive science. Interdisciplinary approaches to issues in cognition including memory language problem solving learning perception and action.  Crosslisted with CS and PSYC6795.

ISYE.name: Reliability Engineering
ISYE.description: Topics include hazard functions life distributions censoring life tables nonparametric and parametric estimation and inference accelerated life testing structure functions reliability and maintenance systems replacement theory.

ISYE.name: Systems Monitoring and Prognostics
ISYE.description: The course focuses on sensor-based condition monitoring techniques modeling of degradation processes fault diagnostics and prognostics of failures in engineering systems using stochastic and statistical methods.

ISYE.name: Advanced Simulation
ISYE.description: Topics include generalized semi-Markov processes input and output analysis random number variate and sample path generation rare event simulation and optimization via simulation.

ISYE.name: Simulation Theory and Methods
ISYE.description: Theory algorithms and applications of computer simulation. Topics include generalized semi-Markov processes input-output analysis random number variate and sample path generation variance reduction techniques and optimization via simulation.  This course is intended for Ph.D. students.

ISYE.name: Master's Thesis
ISYE.description: Required of degree candidates in the masters thesis option.

ISYE.name: Production and Service Systems Engineering
ISYE.description: Advanced models in operations planning scheduling and control of supply chain production and service systems. Intended for Ph.D. students.

ISYE.name: Logistics Systems Engineering
ISYE.description: Advanced modeling and analysis of freight transportation and logistics systems.  Intended for Ph.D. students.

ISYE.name: Informatics in Production & Service Systems
ISYE.description: A course covers integration of statistics signal processing and control for variability reduction (modeling analysis diagnosis control) for complex systems in a data rich environment.

ISYE.name: Real-time Interactive Simulation
ISYE.description: Principles and laboratory experience in design and implementation of interactive simulations of complex dynamic systems.

ISYE.name: Advanced Design of Experiments
ISYE.description: Random and mixed models nested and blocked designs. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

ISYE.name: Advanced Statistical Modeling
ISYE.description: Nonlinear models logistic regression loglinear models. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

ISYE.name: Multivariate Data Analysis
ISYE.description: Multivariate ANOVA principal components factor analysis etc. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

ISYE.name: Data Mining and Statistical Learning
ISYE.description: Topics include neural networks support vector machines classification trees boosting and discriminant analyses. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

ISYE.name: Linear Statistical Models I
ISYE.description: Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

ISYE.name: Graph Algorithms
ISYE.description: Algorithms for graph problems such as maximum flow covering matching coloring planarity minimum cuts shortest paths and connectivity. Crosslisted with MATH7510 and CS7510.

ISYE.name: Case Studies in Logistics/Manufacturing
ISYE.description: Advanced topics in logistics and manufacturing through the use of industrial case studies.  Difficult modeling issues such as data representation and consistency will be introduced.

ISYE.name: Theory of Linear Inequalities
ISYE.description: Theoretical foundations of linear and integer programming. Topics include representation of polyhedra polarity simplex and ellipsoid algorithms diophantine equations Hilbert bases total dual integrality and others.

ISYE.name: Convexity
ISYE.description: Convex sets theory of finite systems of linear inequalities convex functions convex programming.

ISYE.name: Advanced Nonlinear Programming
ISYE.description: Convex programming linear conic quadratic and semidefinite programming cheap optimization methods for extremely large-scale convex problems.

ISYE.name: Advanced Combinatorial Optimization
ISYE.description: Typical coverage includes Matching theory network optimization traversals in graphs integrality of polyhedra matroids covers cliques and stable sets.

ISYE.name: Advanced Integer Programming
ISYE.description: General integer modeling concepts valid inequalities and facets duality general algorithms such as branch-and-bound and branch-and-cut special purpose algorithms applications.

ISYE.name: Computational Mathematical Programming
ISYE.description: Study of solution techniques in mathematical optimization emphasizing computational aspects of both theory and algorithms.

ISYE.name: Mathematical Foundations of Machine Learning
ISYE.description: Provides the mathematical background for two of the pillars of modern data science linear algebra and applied probability.

ISYE.name: Probabilistic Graphical Models in Machine Learning
ISYE.description: The course provides an introduction to theory and practice of graphical models in machine learning. It covers three main aspects representation probabilistic inference and learning.

ISYE.name: Cognitive Modeling
ISYE.description: A hands-on course covering a range of cognitive methodologies. It explores the analysis development construction and evaluation of models of cognitive processing.  Crosslisted with CS and PSYC7790.

ISYE.name: Seminar
ISYE.description: Audit basis only.

ISYE.name: Seminar
ISYE.description: Audit basis only.

ISYE.name: Seminar
ISYE.description: Audit basis only.

ISYE.name: Contemporary Topics in System Informatics and Control
ISYE.description: A seminar course to introduce important research problems and applications related to the system informatics and control in production and service systems.

ISYE.name: Colloquium in Cognitive Sciences
ISYE.description: Reading of research papers by leading cognitive scientists attendance at their colloquia and meeting with them to discuss research. Crosslisted with CS and PSYC8795.

ISYE.name: Special Topics in ISYE
ISYE.description: Special Topics in Industrial and Systems Engineering.

ISYE.name: Special Topics
ISYE.description: Special topics in Industrial and Systems Engineering.

ISYE.name: Special Topics
ISYE.description: Special topics in Industrial and Systems Engineering.

ISYE.name: Special Topics in Operations Research
ISYE.description: Special Topics in the field of Operations Research.

ISYE.name: Advanced Topics in Statistics
ISYE.description: For Ph.D. students.

ISYE.name: Topics in Manufacturing
ISYE.description: Current topics in manufacturing including manufacturing automation and controls advanced planning systems heuristic scheduling techniques stochastic models of manufacturing systems advanced warehousing and materials handling.

ISYE.name: Topics in Logistics
ISYE.description: Current topics in logistics including inventory control in supply chain design stochastic vehicle routing computational methods in logistics systems location theory and geographic information systems.

ISYE.name: Advanced Topics in Stochastics
ISYE.description: Coverage of advanced topics of interest that support research interests of students in the field.

ISYE.name: Advanced Topics in Simulation
ISYE.description: Coverage of advanced topics of interest that support research interests of students in the field.

ISYE.name: Advanced Topics in Linear and Discrete Optimization
ISYE.description: Topics may vary with each offering and include subjects such as integer programming combinatorics graphs and networks matching matroids polyhedral combinatroics as well as others.

ISYE.name: Advanced Topics in Nonlinear Optimization
ISYE.description: Similar to ISYE8871 but deals with subjects in nonlinear programming interior-point methods convexity global optimization etc. Topics may vary each term.

ISYE.name: Teaching Assistantship
ISYE.description: For graduate students holding graduate teaching assistantships.

ISYE.name: Research Assistantship
ISYE.description: For graduate students holding graduate research assistantships.

INTA.name: Effective Study Abroad
INTA.description: Introduces essential background information concerning countries concepts and what to do in order to gain maximum benefit from participation in school-sponsored study abroad programs.

INTA.name: The World Today
INTA.description: Introduction to current issues of politics geography and history around the globe using a wide variety of media and sources.

INTA.name: Introduction to International Relations
INTA.description: An introduction to the major principles concepts actors and theories of the international system and their application to current issues in world affairs.

INTA.name: American Government in Comparative Perspective
INTA.description: Examines American government in relation to other political and economic systems in countries around the world. Credit not allowed for both POL1101 and INTA1200.

INTA.name: Careers in International Affairs
INTA.description: Reinforces career development and planning process for international affairs majors.  Includes facilitation of decision-making skills job search strategies self-assessment and overview from industry speakers.  Credit not allowed for both INTA2001 and INTA 1001.

INTA.name: Empirical Methods
INTA.description: Develops skills in research design model building and hypothesis construction. Provides experience in using computer software programs to perform statistical tests including t-tests chi-square and regression.

INTA.name: Ethics in International Affairs
INTA.description: Surveys the main traditions and theories of international ethics with a focus on intervention and the use of force human rights self-determination and global distributive justice.

INTA.name: Science, Technology, and International Affairs
INTA.description: An overview of science and technology as a determinant in the development and functioning of states and societies worldwide and the international context for the development of science and technology.

INTA.name: Introduction to Global WMD Issues
INTA.description: This course will explore the challenges history and major theoretical frameworks relating to weapons of mass destruction (WMD).

INTA.name: Intro to Global Development
INTA.description: Mainstream and critical approaches to development the role of diverse institutions and projects and implications for sustainability in the countries of the global south.

INTA.name: Theoretical Approaches to Great Power Relations
INTA.description: Juxtaposes competing explanations for the patterns of conflict and cooperation among nations illustrated by relations among the great powers of Europe and Asia during the past two centuries.

INTA.name: Introduction to International Security
INTA.description: Introduction to the role of theory and provide an understanding of the significance of various issues in international security.

INTA.name: Comparative Political Philosophies and Ideologies
INTA.description: Explores political ideologies and philosophies including theories of democracy capitalism and socialism as well as rival views of the good society in comparative and historical perspective.

INTA.name: Government and Politics of Western Europe
INTA.description: A comparative analysis of the politics and major institutions of the countries of contemporary Western Europe.

INTA.name: Politics of the European Union
INTA.description: Introduction and overview of the history and politics of the European Union from its inception to the new era of development under the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

INTA.name: Government and Politics of Asia
INTA.description: An introduction to the major issues and aspects of the politics societies and cultures of East Asia and the changing role of the region in international affairs.

INTA.name: Government, Politics and Society of Latin America
INTA.description: Introduction to the study of historical forces cultural production identity political development and contemporary issues in Latin America.

INTA.name: Government, Politics and Society of the Middle East
INTA.description: Introduction to the study and analysis of contemporary Middle East politics with an emphasis on the Arab states.

INTA.name: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
INTA.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

INTA.name: Undergraduate Research
INTA.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

INTA.name: Special Topics
INTA.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA.name: Special Topics
INTA.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA.name: Special Topics
INTA.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA.name: Special Topics
INTA.description: Topics of current interest in International Affairs.

INTA.name: Special Problems
INTA.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA.name: Special Problems
INTA.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA.name: Special Problems
INTA.description: Independent study with a faculty member.

INTA.name: International Technology Transfer
INTA.description: Explores the impact of technology transfer on key contexts such as economic development and the international diffusion of defense production and technology.

INTA.name: War in the 20th Century
INTA.description: Provides historical foundation and understanding of the causes conduct and consequences of modern war to support informed discussion and analysis of contemporary crisis and conflict.

INTA.name: Contemporary Mexico
INTA.description: This course examines the socio-economic and political history and development of twentieth century Mexico with a focus on current problems and issues.

INTA.name: Human Rights in a Technological World
INTA.description: Explores how processes of globalization and advances in communication and technology have heightened and shaped human rights as a concern in international politics.

INTA.name: Energy, Environment, and Policy
INTA.description: Explores the interface between energy security and environmental sustainability with the aim of understanding the consequences of policy decisions for ecological social and economic systems.

INTA.name: Energy and International Security
INTA.description: Examines issues at the intersection of national energy security and international conflict and cooperation.

INTA.name: Space Policy
INTA.description: Examination of the origins evolution and range of current challenges and debates in international space policy issues including civil military and commercial activities.

INTA.name: Global Politics of Technology
INTA.description: Examination of the economic and political dynamics that influence how regulations governing technology are adopted around the world.

INTA.name: The Meaning of Global Citizenship
INTA.description: Explore the meaning of global citizenship in scholarly and public debates and how it is practiced by individuals and institutionalized by universities corporations and organizations.

INTA.name: International Institutions
INTA.description: Scrutinizes the evolution of international institutions and juxtaposes competing theoretical approaches for understanding the changing roles and functions of institutions in world affairs.

INTA.name: The Problem of Proliferation
INTA.description: Explores the political and economic issues both international as well as domestic involved in the spread of the weapons of mass destruction since the end of the Second World War.

INTA.name: The Challenge of Terrorism
INTA.description: Examines the contexts that nurture domestic and international terrorism the variety of terrorist organizations and alternative approaches to combating the problem.

INTA.name: International Negotiations
INTA.description: Examines the theories of bargaining and negotiation with an emphasis on explaining success and failure in U.S. foreign policy and national security negotiations.

INTA.name: U
INTA.description: Analyzes the formulation and implementation of Americas foreign policy from 1914 to the present stressing economic political and strategic factors.

INTA.name: U
INTA.description: Examines contemporary American defense policy including the formulation of strategy the defense budget force structure and nontraditional uses of military force.

INTA.name: European Security Issues
INTA.description: Explores the contemporary European security environment including threats challenges and various security architectures (e.g. NATO the WEU and the OSCE).

INTA.name: Foreign Policies of Russia and Eurasia
INTA.description: Examines the many dimensions of the foreign and security policies of Russia and the other new post-Soviet states of Russia and Eurasia.

INTA.name: Foreign Policy of China
INTA.description: Analyzes the major dimensions of the foreign policies of the Peoples Republic of China and the domestic and international influences shaping those policies.

INTA.name: Pacific Security Issues
INTA.description: Examines past present and future security concerns in the Pacific including the Korean peninsula Japanese defense the emergence of China as a military power and the forward basing of American troops and materiel.

INTA.name: Comparative Politics
INTA.description: Contrasts competing theoretical perspectives in the comparative analysis of political systems.

INTA.name: Government and Politics of Germany
INTA.description: Examines the government and politics of Germany with an in-depth focus on the post-1945 period.  NOTE When taught jointly with the School of Modern Languages all lectures assignments and readings are in German.

INTA.name: Post-Soviet Government and Politics
INTA.description: Focuses on the challenge of building new social political and economic systems in Russia but also considers some of the special problems confronting the other fourteen post-Soviet states.

INTA.name: Transatlantic Relations
INTA.description: Analysis of the different aspects of the relationship between the US and the EU and how it is characterized by cooperation conflict and competition.

INTA.name: Government and Politics of China
INTA.description: Investigates the structure and institutions of political power as well as the patterns and features of political change in the contemporary Peoples Republic of China.

INTA.name: Government and Politics of Japan
INTA.description: Examines the main institutions policies and politics of contemporary Japan. Investigates the impact of social cultural and economic forces on Japans government and politics.

INTA.name: Sustainable Megaregion
INTA.description: Explores the ways in which environmental economic social and technological forces shape megaregion sustainability in through comparison with megaregions in countries around the world.

INTA.name: Government and Politics of Africa
INTA.description: A survey of the history cultures social systems governments economies and international roles of Africa. Selected case studies of individual countries are presented.

INTA.name: Latin American Politics
INTA.description: Surveys the government and politics of Latin America.  The course begins with an overview of the regions geography and history and then explains why demographic government has had a tenuous existence in this area.

INTA.name: Soccer and Global Politics
INTA.description: An examination of regional and national identity development and politics through the history of soccer.

INTA.name: US - Latin American Relations
INTA.description: Study of government and non-governmental influences on policy and effectiveness of political economic and military instruments of power in Latin America.

INTA.name: Middle East Relations
INTA.description: Course will provide an in-depth understanding of the Arab-Israeli conflict using theories of international relations and comparative politics.

INTA.name: International Political Economy
INTA.description: Analyzes the relationship between political and economic issues in international affairs. Examines the interaction of states and markets in the context of trade investment and production.

INTA.name: Political Economy of Development
INTA.description: Surveys theories of economic development and political change and examines a range of cases that include the European-American experience the East Asian episode and the transition from socialism.

INTA.name: International Trade and Production
INTA.description: Examines the political economy of international trade and the global production process with particular emphasis on conflict and cooperation in national competition for high- technology industries.

INTA.name: Political Economy of European Integration
INTA.description: Explores the processes and problems of political and economic integration in the European Union the worlds largest trading bloc.

INTA.name: Political Economy of China
INTA.description: Examines the centuries of stagnation and the recent rapid growth of the Chinese economy and seeks to understand the current interaction between politics and economic development in the Peoples Republic of China.

INTA.name: Political Economy of Japan
INTA.description: Surveys the political foundations and economic achievements of modern Japan.  Explores the interaction of domestic and international forces and analyzes Japans changing world role.

INTA.name: Global Issues and Leadership
INTA.description: Invited project based seminar Uses global issues to explore diverse viewpoints cultures and cognitive biases to develop leadership and presentation skills in small diverse groups.

INTA.name: Special Topics
INTA.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.

INTA.name: Special Topics
INTA.description: Selected topics will vary from term to term.
